verses.text: Now the Lord called to Moses, and spoke to him from the tabernacle of testimony, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘If a man among you should offer gifts to the Lord from the cattle—the oxen or the sheep—you shall offer your gifts. If his gift should be a whole burnt offering from the oxen, he shall offer a male without blemish.

If his gift should be a whole burnt offering from the oxen, he shall offer a male without blemish.

verses.text: ‘Now if a soul should offer a gift for a grain offering to the Lord, his gift shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil on it, and put frankincense on it. He shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests, one of whom shall take from it his handful of fine flour and oil with all the frankincense.
parts: ‘Now if a soul should offer a gift for a grain offering to the Lord, his gift shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil on it, and put frankincense on it.
He shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests, one of whom shall take from it his handful of fine flour and oil with all the frankincense.

verses.text: The rest of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons.
parts: The rest of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons.

verses.text: But if you should offer a gift as a grain offering baked in the oven, a gift of fine flour to the Lord, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.
parts: But if you should offer a gift as a grain offering baked in the oven, a gift of fine flour to the Lord, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

verses.text: But if your gift should be a grain offering fried in a pan, it shall be of fine flour, unleavened, and mixed with oil.
parts: But if your gift should be a grain offering fried in a pan, it shall be of fine flour, unleavened, and mixed with oil.

verses.text: You shall break it in pieces and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering to the Lord.
parts: You shall break it in pieces and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering to the Lord.

verses.text: If your gift should be a grain offering from the grate, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.
parts: If your gift should be a grain offering from the grate, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.

verses.text: You shall offer the grain offering made of these things to the Lord; and when it is presented to the priest, he shall bring it to the altar.
parts: You shall offer the grain offering made of these things to the Lord; and when it is presented to the priest, he shall bring it to the altar.

verses.text: Then the priest shall take from the grain offering its memorial portion, and put it on the altar as a burnt offering, for a sweet aroma to the Lord.
parts: Then the priest shall take from the grain offering its memorial portion, and put it on the altar as a burnt offering, for a sweet aroma to the Lord.

verses.text: But what is left of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons.
parts: But what is left of the grain offering shall be Aaron's and his sons.

verses.text: ‘No grain offering you offer to the Lord shall be made with leaven, for you shall burn no leaven or honey in any burnt offering to the Lord.
parts: ‘No grain offering you offer to the Lord shall be made with leaven, for you shall burn no leaven or honey in any burnt offering to the Lord.

verses.text: As for a gift of firstfruits, you shall offer them to the Lord, but they shall not be offered on the altar for a sweet aroma.
parts: As for a gift of firstfruits, you shall offer them to the Lord, but they shall not be offered on the altar for a sweet aroma.

verses.text: Now every gift of your grain offering you shall season with salt; you shall not allow the salt of the Lord's covenant to be lacking from your grain offerings.
parts: Now every gift of your grain offering you shall season with salt; you shall not allow the salt of the Lord's covenant to be lacking from your grain offerings.

verses.text: If you should offer a grain offering of your firstfruits to the Lord, you shall offer for the grain offering of your firstfruits green heads of grain roasted on the fire, grain beaten from full heads for the Lord.

verses.text: The priest shall then offer its memorial portion: its beaten grain and oil, with all the frankincense.
parts: The priest shall then offer its memorial portion: its beaten grain and oil, with all the frankincense.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘If a soul should sin involuntarily before the Lord against any of the Lord's ordinances, which ought not to be done, and does anything against them, even if he should be the anointed priest, and should sin to the detriment of the people, he shall offer to the Lord for the sin he committed a young bull without blemish from the oxen as a sin offering. He shall offer the young bull at the door of the tabernacle of testimony before the Lord, put his hand on the young bull's head, and kill the young bull before the Lord.
parts: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘If a soul should sin involuntarily before the Lord against any of the Lord's ordinances, which ought not to be done, and does anything against them,

even if he should be the anointed priest, and should sin to the detriment of the people, he shall offer to the Lord for the sin he committed a young bull without blemish from the oxen as a sin offering.
He shall offer the young bull at the door of the tabernacle of testimony before the Lord, put his hand on the young bull's head, and kill the young bull before the Lord.

verses.text: Then the anointed and consecrated priest shall take some of the young bull's blood and bring it to the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: Then the anointed and consecrated priest shall take some of the young bull's blood and bring it to the tabernacle of testimony.

parts: The priest shall dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before the Lord, in front of the veil of the holy place.

verses.text: Then the priest shall put some of the blood of the young bull on the horns of the altar of the incense compound before the Lord in the tabernacle of testimony; and he shall pour the remaining blood of the young bull at the base of the altar of whole burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: Then the priest shall put some of the blood of the young bull on the horns of the altar of the incense compound before the Lord in the tabernacle of testimony; and he shall pour the remaining blood of the young bull at the base of the altar of whole burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: ‘Now if the whole congregation of Israel acts involuntarily in ignorance, and it is hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they did something against any of the Lord's commandments, which should not be done, and committed sin; when the sin they committed becomes known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for the sin, and offer it before the doors of the tabernacle of testimony.

when the sin they committed becomes known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for the sin, and offer it before the doors of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: and the sin he committed comes to his knowledge, he shall offer as his gift a kid of the goats, a male without blemish.

verses.text: He shall put his hand on the head of the kid and kill it at the place where they kill the whole burnt offering before the Lord.

verses.text: The priest shall then take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of whole burnt offering, and pour its remaining blood at the base of the altar of whole burnt offering.

verses.text: ‘If any soul of the people of the land should sin involuntarily by doing something against any of the Lord's commandments, which ought not to be done, and commits sin, and the sin he committed comes to his knowledge, then he shall bring a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for the sin he committed.
parts: ‘If any soul of the people of the land should sin involuntarily by doing something against any of the Lord's commandments, which ought not to be done, and commits sin,
and the sin he committed comes to his knowledge, then he shall bring a kid of the goats, a female without blemish, for the sin he committed.

verses.text: Then the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of whole burnt offering, and pour all its remaining blood at the base of the altar.

verses.text: If he should bring as his gift a sheep for a sin offering, he shall offer a female without blemish.

parts: Then he shall put his hand on the head of the sin offering and kill it as a sin offering at the place where they kill the whole burnt offering.

verses.text: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of whole burnt offering, and pour all its remaining blood at the base of the altar.

verses.text: ‘Now if a soul should sin in hearing the utterance of an oath, and is a witness, whether he saw or knew of the matter—if he does not tell it, he shall bear his guilt.
parts: ‘Now if a soul should sin in hearing the utterance of an oath, and is a witness, whether he saw or knew of the matter—if he does not tell it, he shall bear his guilt.

verses.text: Or if a soul should touch any unclean thing, whether it is the carcass of an unclean animal, or one torn by a wild animal, or the unclean carcasses of creeping things, or the unclean carcasses of cattle;
parts: Or if a soul should touch any unclean thing, whether it is the carcass of an unclean animal, or one torn by a wild animal, or the unclean carcasses of creeping things, or the unclean carcasses of cattle;

verses.text: or should touch human uncleanness—even by any uncleanness, which by touching it he is defiled—and he is unaware of it, but afterwards becomes aware, he shall bear his guilt.
parts: or should touch human uncleanness—even by any uncleanness, which by touching it he is defiled—and he is unaware of it, but afterwards becomes aware, he shall bear his guilt.

verses.text: Or if a soul should swear, speaking thoughtlessly with his lips to do evil or good, whatever a man may pronounce by an oath, and it should escape his notice—and thus he should sin in one of these things,
parts: Or if a soul should swear, speaking thoughtlessly with his lips to do evil or good, whatever a man may pronounce by an oath, and it should escape his notice—and thus he should sin in one of these things,

verses.text: then he shall confess his sin in that thing;
parts: then he shall confess his sin in that thing;

verses.text: and he shall bring for his trespass against the Lord, and for his guilt, a female from the sheep, a lamb, or a kid of the goats as a sin offering.
parts: and he shall bring for his trespass against the Lord, and for his guilt, a female from the sheep, a lamb, or a kid of the goats as a sin offering.

verses.text: ‘But if he should be unable to afford a sheep, he shall bring for the sin he committed two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the Lord: one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering.
parts: ‘But if he should be unable to afford a sheep, he shall bring for the sin he committed two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the Lord: one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering.

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Now if a soul should be oblivious and sin involuntarily in regard to the holy things of the Lord, he shall bring to the Lord for his trespass in which he transgressed a ram without blemish from the sheep, with your valuation in shekels of silver according to the shekel of the holy place. Thus he shall make restitution wherein he sinned in regard to the holy things, and he shall add one-fifth to give to the priest.
parts: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Now if a soul should be oblivious and sin involuntarily in regard to the holy things of the Lord, he shall bring to the Lord for his trespass in which he transgressed a ram without blemish from the sheep, with your valuation in shekels of silver according to the shekel of the holy place.
Thus he shall make restitution wherein he sinned in regard to the holy things, and he shall add one-fifth to give to the priest.

verses.text: “Now if a soul should sin and do anything against the Lord's commandments, though he may not know it, nevertheless, he trespassed and shall bear his guilt.

verses.text: It is a trespass offering; he has certainly trespassed against the Lord.”
parts: It is a trespass offering; he has certainly trespassed against the Lord.”

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Now if a soul should sin and actually disregard the Lord's commandments by lying to his neighbor about a deposit entrusted to him for safekeeping, or about a joint-ownership, or about a robbery, or if he wronged his neighbor in something, or if he found what was lost and should lie about it and swear falsely—in any one of these things a man may do when he sins: then it shall be, whenever he should trespass and is guilty, he shall restore what he stole, or the thing he extorted, or what was delivered to him for safekeeping, or the lost thing he found, or everything about which he swore falsely.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Command Aaron and his sons, saying, ‘Now this is the law of the whole burnt offering: The whole burnt offering shall be on the hearth upon the altar all night until morning, and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it; it shall not be put out.

verses.text: Then the priest shall put the linen trousers on his body; then he shall put on his linen garment, and take up the ashes of the whole burnt offering, which the fire consumed on the altar; and he shall put them beside the altar.
parts: Then the priest shall put the linen trousers on his body; then he shall put on his linen garment, and take up the ashes of the whole burnt offering, which the fire consumed on the altar; and he shall put them beside the altar.

verses.text: He shall then take off his linen garment, put on another one, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.

verses.text: So the fire on the altar shall be burning; it shall not be put out.
parts: So the fire on the altar shall be burning; it shall not be put out.

verses.text: A fire shall always be burning on the altar; it shall never go out.
parts: A fire shall always be burning on the altar; it shall never go out.

verses.text: ‘Now this is the law of the grain offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it in front of the altar before the Lord.
parts: ‘Now this is the law of the grain offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it in front of the altar before the Lord.

verses.text: He shall take from it his handful of the fine flour of the grain offering, with its oil and frankincense which is on the grain offering, and offer it on the altar of burnt offering for a sweet aroma, a memorial to the Lord.

verses.text: Then Aaron and his sons shall eat what is left.
parts: Then Aaron and his sons shall eat what is left.

verses.text: It shall not be baked with leaven.
parts: It shall not be baked with leaven.

verses.text: All the males of the priests shall eat it.

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “This is the gift of Aaron and his sons, which they shall offer to the Lord on the day you anoint him: one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a daily grain offering, half of it in the morning and half in the evening.
parts: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

verses.text: For every grain offering of a priest shall be wholly burned.

verses.text: But no sin offering whose blood may have been brought into the tabernacle of testimony to make atonement in the holy place shall be eaten.

verses.text: ‘Now this is the law of the trespass offering of the ram (it is most holy): In the place where they kill the whole burnt offering, they shall kill the ram of the trespass offering before the Lord; and its blood he shall pour all around the base of the altar.
parts: ‘Now this is the law of the trespass offering of the ram (it is most holy): In the place where they kill the whole burnt offering, they shall kill the ram of the trespass offering before the Lord; and its blood he shall pour all around the base of the altar.

verses.text: Every male among the priests may eat these things.

verses.text: The trespass offering is like the sin offering; there is one law for them both: the priest who makes atonement with it shall have it.
parts: The trespass offering is like the sin offering; there is one law for them both: the priest who makes atonement with it shall have it.

verses.text: Now the priest who offers a man's whole burnt offering shall have for himself the skin of the whole burnt offering he offered.

verses.text: Every grain offering, whether prepared with or without oil, shall belong to all the sons of Aaron, to one as much as the other.

verses.text: ‘This is the law of the sacrifice of the peace offering, which he shall offer to the Lord: If he should offer it for a thanksgiving, he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving loaves of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened cakes smeared with oil, and fine flour kneaded with oil. Besides the unleavened loaves, he shall offer with his gifts leavened bread with the sacrifice of thanksgiving of his peace offering.
parts: ‘This is the law of the sacrifice of the peace offering, which he shall offer to the Lord: If he should offer it for a thanksgiving, he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving loaves of fine flour mixed with oil, and unleavened cakes smeared with oil, and fine flour kneaded with oil.

verses.text: Again the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘You shall not eat any fat of oxen, sheep, or goats.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, the anointing oil, a young bull as the sin offering, two rams, and a basket of unleavened bread; and gather all the congregation together at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.”

and gather all the congregation together at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.”

verses.text: Then Moses said to the congregation, “This is the word the Lord commanded us to do.”

verses.text: Moses then took the anointing oil, and he sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointed the altar, and sanctified it, and all its utensils, and the laver and its base, to sanctify them.

verses.text: Moses then took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood on the altar and sprinkled it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and their garments with him; and he sanctified Aaron and his garments, and his sons and their garments with him.

verses.text: After this, Moses said to Aaron and his sons, “Boil the flesh in the court of the tabernacle of testimony, in a holy place, and eat it there with the bread in the basket of consecration as I was commanded, saying, ‘Aaron and his sons shall eat it.’ What remains of the flesh and the bread shall be burned with fire.
parts: After this, Moses said to Aaron and his sons, “Boil the flesh in the court of the tabernacle of testimony, in a holy place, and eat it there with the bread in the basket of consecration as I was commanded, saying, ‘Aaron and his sons shall eat it.’ What remains of the flesh and the bread shall be burned with fire.

verses.text: As the Lord did on this day, He commanded to do to make atonement for you.

verses.text: Therefore you shall stay at the door of the tabernacle of testimony day and night for seven days and keep the charge of the Lord, that you may not die; for the Lord God so commanded me.”

verses.text: Moses said to Aaron, “Take for yourself a young calf from the oxen as a sin offering and a ram as a whole burnt offering, without blemish, and offer them before the Lord.

verses.text: also a young bull and a ram as peace offerings before the Lord, and a grain offering mixed with oil; for today the Lord will appear to you.’ ”

verses.text: So they brought what Moses commanded before the tabernacle of testimony, and all the congregation drew near and stood before the Lord.

verses.text: Then Moses spoke this word, “This is the thing the Lord commanded you to do, and the glory of the Lord will appear among you.”
parts: Then Moses spoke this word, “This is the thing the Lord commanded you to do, and the glory of the Lord will appear among you.”

verses.text: Moses then said to Aaron, “Go to the altar, offer your sin offering and your whole burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and for your house.
parts: Moses then said to Aaron, “Go to the altar, offer your sin offering and your whole burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself and for your house.

verses.text: Aaron therefore went to the altar and killed the young calf of the sin offering.
parts: Aaron therefore went to the altar and killed the young calf of the sin offering.

verses.text: Then Aaron's sons brought the blood to him; and he dipped his finger in the blood, put it on the horns of the altar, and poured the blood at the base of the altar.
parts: Then Aaron's sons brought the blood to him; and he dipped his finger in the blood, put it on the horns of the altar, and poured the blood at the base of the altar.

verses.text: But the fat, the kidneys, and the fatty lobe from the liver of the sin offering he offered on the altar, as the Lord commanded Moses.
parts: But the fat, the kidneys, and the fatty lobe from the liver of the sin offering he offered on the altar, as the Lord commanded Moses.

verses.text: The flesh and the hide he burned with fire outside the camp.
parts: The flesh and the hide he burned with fire outside the camp.

verses.text: Then he killed the burnt offering; and Aaron's sons presented to him the blood, which he poured all around on the altar.
parts: Then he killed the burnt offering; and Aaron's sons presented to him the blood, which he poured all around on the altar.

verses.text: Then they presented the whole burnt offering to him, with its pieces and head, and he put them on the altar.
parts: Then they presented the whole burnt offering to him, with its pieces and head, and he put them on the altar.

verses.text: He washed the stomach and the feet and put them on the altar for a whole burnt offering.
parts: He washed the stomach and the feet and put them on the altar for a whole burnt offering.

verses.text: Then he brought the people's gift and took the young goat, which was the sin offering for the people, and killed it and offered it for sin, like the first one.
parts: Then he brought the people's gift and took the young goat, which was the sin offering for the people, and killed it and offered it for sin, like the first one.

verses.text: He also brought the whole burnt offering and offered it according to the prescribed manner.
parts: He also brought the whole burnt offering and offered it according to the prescribed manner.

verses.text: Then he brought the grain offering, took a handful of it, and put it on the altar, besides the whole burnt offering of the morning.
parts: Then he brought the grain offering, took a handful of it, and put it on the altar, besides the whole burnt offering of the morning.

verses.text: He also killed the young bull and the ram as sacrifices of peace offerings, which were for the people; and Aaron's sons presented to him the blood, which he poured all around on the altar.

verses.text: The fat from the young bull and the ram: the fatty tail, what covers the stomach and the kidneys, and the fatty lobe attached to the liver,

verses.text: they put on the breasts.

verses.text: but the breasts and the right thigh Aaron removed as a choice portion before the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.

verses.text: Then Aaron lifted his hand toward the people, blessed them, and came down from offering the sin offering, the whole burnt offerings, and peace offerings. After this, Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of testimony, and came out, and blessed all the people.

verses.text: and fire came out from the Lord, and consumed the things on the altar, both the whole burnt offerings and the fat.

verses.text: Now Nadab and Abihu, Aaron's sons, each took his censer and put fire in it, put incense on it, and offered strange fire before the Lord, which He had not commanded them. So fire went out from the Lord and devoured them, and they died before the Lord.

So fire went out from the Lord and devoured them, and they died before the Lord.

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord spoke, saying, ‘By those who come near Me I shall be sanctified; and before all the congregation I shall be glorified.’ ” So Aaron was greatly distressed.
parts: Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the Lord spoke, saying, ‘By those who come near Me I shall be sanctified; and before all the congregation I shall be glorified.’ ” So Aaron was greatly distressed.

verses.text: Moses then called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel, Aaron's uncle, and said to them, “Come near, carry your brethren from the presence of the sanctuary outside the camp.”
parts: Moses then called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel, Aaron's uncle, and said to them, “Come near, carry your brethren from the presence of the sanctuary outside the camp.”

verses.text: So they came near and carried them by their tunics outside the camp, as Moses said.
parts: So they came near and carried them by their tunics outside the camp, as Moses said.

verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons, “Do not uncover your heads, nor take off your garments, lest you die, and wrath come upon all the congregation.
parts: Then Moses said to Aaron and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons, “Do not uncover your heads, nor take off your garments, lest you die, and wrath come upon all the congregation.

verses.text: You shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of testimony, lest you die, for the anointing oil of the Lord is upon you.” So they did according to Moses’ word.
parts: You shall not go out from the door of the tabernacle of testimony, lest you die, for the anointing oil of the Lord is upon you.” So they did according to Moses’ word.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron, saying, “Do not drink wine and strong drink, you nor your sons with you, when you go into the tabernacle of testimony, or when you approach the altar, lest you die (it shall be an ordinance forever throughout your generations), that you may distinguish between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean, and that you may teach the children of Israel all the ordinances which the Lord spoke to them by the hand of Moses.”
parts: Then the Lord spoke to Aaron, saying, “Do not drink wine and strong drink, you nor your sons with you, when you go into the tabernacle of testimony, or when you approach the altar, lest you die (it shall be an ordinance forever throughout your generations), that you may distinguish between holy and unholy, and between unclean and clean, and that you may teach the children of Israel all the ordinances which the Lord spoke to them by the hand of Moses.”

verses.text: Then Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons who were left, “Take the grain offering that remains from the burnt offerings of the Lord and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it is most holy.
parts: Then Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and Ithamar, his sons who were left, “Take the grain offering that remains from the burnt offerings of the Lord and eat it without leaven beside the altar; for it is most holy.

verses.text: You shall eat it in a holy place, because from the burnt offerings of the Lord, it belongs to you and your sons by ordinance; for thus I was commanded.
parts: You shall eat it in a holy place, because from the burnt offerings of the Lord, it belongs to you and your sons by ordinance; for thus I was commanded.

verses.text: The breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the choice portion you shall eat in a clean place, you, your sons, and your household with you; because it was given to you and your sons by ordinance from the peace offerings of the children of Israel.
parts: The breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the choice portion you shall eat in a clean place, you, your sons, and your household with you; because it was given to you and your sons by ordinance from the peace offerings of the children of Israel.

verses.text: The thigh of the choice portion and the breast of the wave offering they shall bring with the burnt offerings of fat to offer as a wave offering before the Lord; and it shall be yours and your sons’ and daughters’ with you by an ordinance forever, as the Lord commanded Moses.”
parts: The thigh of the choice portion and the breast of the wave offering they shall bring with the burnt offerings of fat to offer as a wave offering before the Lord; and it shall be yours and your sons’ and daughters’ with you by an ordinance forever, as the Lord commanded Moses.”

verses.text: Then Moses made careful inquiry about the young goat of the sin offering, and there it was—burned up.
parts: Then Moses made careful inquiry about the young goat of the sin offering, and there it was—burned up.

verses.text: “Why have you not eaten the sin offering in a holy place, since it is most holy; and He gave this to you, to bear the guilt of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the Lord?
parts: “Why have you not eaten the sin offering in a holy place, since it is most holy; and He gave this to you, to bear the guilt of the congregation, to make atonement for them before the Lord?

verses.text: For you did not bring its blood into the holy place; you personally should have eaten it in a holy place, as the Lord commanded me.”
parts: For you did not bring its blood into the holy place; you personally should have eaten it in a holy place, as the Lord commanded me.”

verses.text: Then Aaron spoke to Moses, saying, “If they had offered their sin offering and whole burnt offerings today before the Lord, and these things happened to me, and I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been acceptable to the Lord?”
parts: Then Aaron spoke to Moses, saying, “If they had offered their sin offering and whole burnt offerings today before the Lord, and these things happened to me, and I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been acceptable to the Lord?”

verses.text: So when Moses heard that, he was pleased.
parts: So when Moses heard that, he was pleased.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘These are the animals you may eat among all the animals on the earth: Whatever divides the hoof, having cloven hooves and chewing the cud—that you may eat.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘These are the animals you may eat among all the animals on the earth:
Whatever divides the hoof, having cloven hooves and chewing the cud—that you may eat.

verses.text: Nevertheless these you shall not eat among those that chew the cud or have cloven hooves: the camel, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;
parts: Nevertheless these you shall not eat among those that chew the cud or have cloven hooves: the camel, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;

verses.text: the rock hyrax, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;
parts: the rock hyrax, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;

verses.text: the hare, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;
parts: the hare, because it chews the cud but does not have cloven hooves, is unclean to you;

verses.text: and the swine, though it divides the hoof, having cloven hooves, yet does not chew the cud, is unclean to you.
parts: and the swine, though it divides the hoof, having cloven hooves, yet does not chew the cud, is unclean to you.

verses.text: Their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.
parts: Their flesh you shall not eat, and their carcasses you shall not touch.

verses.text: ‘These you may eat of everything in the water: whatever in the water has fins and scales, whether in the seas or in the rivers—that you may eat.
parts: ‘These you may eat of everything in the water: whatever in the water has fins and scales, whether in the seas or in the rivers—that you may eat.

verses.text: But everything in the water or in the seas or the rivers that does not have fins and scales, from all these, and from every living creature in the water which the waters produce, they are an abomination to you.
parts: But everything in the water or in the seas or the rivers that does not have fins and scales, from all these, and from every living creature in the water which the waters produce, they are an abomination to you.

verses.text: They shall be an abomination to you; you shall not eat their flesh, but you shall regard their carcasses as an abomination.
parts: They shall be an abomination to you; you shall not eat their flesh, but you shall regard their carcasses as an abomination.

verses.text: Whatever in the water does not have fins or scales—that shall be an abomination to you.
parts: Whatever in the water does not have fins or scales—that shall be an abomination to you.

verses.text: ‘Now these you shall regard as an abomination among the birds; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the ossifrage, and the sea eagle, the kite, and the falcon after its kind; every raven after its kind, the ostrich, the short-eared owl, the sea gull, and the hawk after its kind; the little owl, the fisher owl, and the screech owl; the white owl, the jackdaw, and the carrion vulture; the stork, the heron after its kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.

verses.text: ‘Now all flying insects that creep on all fours shall be an abomination to you.
parts: ‘Now all flying insects that creep on all fours shall be an abomination to you.

verses.text: Yet these you may eat of every flying insect that creeps on all fours: those which have jointed legs above their feet with which to leap on the earth.
parts: Yet these you may eat of every flying insect that creeps on all fours: those which have jointed legs above their feet with which to leap on the earth.

verses.text: These you may eat: the locust after its kind, the destroying locust after its kind, the cricket after its kind, and the grasshopper after its kind.
parts: These you may eat: the locust after its kind, the destroying locust after its kind, the cricket after its kind, and the grasshopper after its kind.

verses.text: But all other flying insects which have four feet shall be an abomination to you.
parts: But all other flying insects which have four feet shall be an abomination to you.

verses.text: ‘Now by these you shall become unclean; whoever touches the carcass of any of them shall be unclean until evening; whoever carries part of the carcass of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening: any animal which divides the foot, but is not cloven-hoofed or does not chew the cud, is unclean to you.
parts: ‘Now by these you shall become unclean; whoever touches the carcass of any of them shall be unclean until evening; whoever carries part of the carcass of any of them shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening: any animal which divides the foot, but is not cloven-hoofed or does not chew the cud, is unclean to you.

verses.text: Now whatever goes on its paws, among all kinds of animals that go on all fours, those are unclean to you.
parts: Now whatever goes on its paws, among all kinds of animals that go on all fours, those are unclean to you.

verses.text: Whoever carries any such carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever carries any such carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: ‘These also shall be unclean to you among the creeping things that creep on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and the large lizard after its kind; the gecko, the monitor lizard, the sand reptile, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
parts: ‘These also shall be unclean to you among the creeping things that creep on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and the large lizard after its kind; the gecko, the monitor lizard, the sand reptile, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.

verses.text: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the sand reptile, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
parts: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the sand reptile, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.

verses.text: These are unclean to you among all that creep.
parts: These are unclean to you among all that creep.

verses.text: Anything on which any of them falls when they are dead shall be unclean, whether it is any item of wood or clothing or skin or sack, whatever item it is in which work is done, it must be put in water.
parts: Anything on which any of them falls when they are dead shall be unclean, whether it is any item of wood or clothing or skin or sack, whatever item it is in which work is done, it must be put in water.

verses.text: Any earthen vessel into which any of them falls you shall break; and whatever is in it shall be unclean:
parts: Any earthen vessel into which any of them falls you shall break; and whatever is in it shall be unclean:

verses.text: in such a vessel, any edible food upon which water falls becomes unclean, and any drink that may be drunk from it becomes unclean.
parts: in such a vessel, any edible food upon which water falls becomes unclean, and any drink that may be drunk from it becomes unclean.

verses.text: Everything on which a carcass falls shall be unclean; whether it is an oven or cooking stove, it shall be broken down; for they are unclean and shall be unclean to you.
parts: Everything on which a carcass falls shall be unclean; whether it is an oven or cooking stove, it shall be broken down; for they are unclean and shall be unclean to you.

verses.text: Nevertheless, a spring or a cistern where there is plenty of water shall be clean, but whatever touches any such carcass becomes unclean.
parts: Nevertheless, a spring or a cistern where there is plenty of water shall be clean, but whatever touches any such carcass becomes unclean.

verses.text: But if a part of any such carcass falls on any planting seed which is to be sown, it remains clean.
parts: But if a part of any such carcass falls on any planting seed which is to be sown, it remains clean.

verses.text: However, if water is put on the seed, and if a part of any such carcass falls on it, it becomes unclean to you.
parts: However, if water is put on the seed, and if a part of any such carcass falls on it, it becomes unclean to you.

verses.text: Now if any animal you are permitted to eat dies, he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening.
parts: Now if any animal you are permitted to eat dies, he who touches its carcass shall be unclean until evening.

verses.text: He who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.
parts: He who eats of its carcass shall wash his clothes and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: ‘Now every creeping thing that creeps on the earth shall be an abomination.
parts: ‘Now every creeping thing that creeps on the earth shall be an abomination.

verses.text: Whatever crawls on its belly, whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet among all creeping things that creep on the earth—these you shall not eat, for they are an abomination.
parts: Whatever crawls on its belly, whatever goes on all fours, or whatever has many feet among all creeping things that creep on the earth—these you shall not eat, for they are an abomination.

verses.text: You shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creeps; nor shall you make yourselves unclean with them, lest you be defiled by them.
parts: You shall not make yourselves abominable with any creeping thing that creeps; nor shall you make yourselves unclean with them, lest you be defiled by them.

verses.text: For I am the Lord your God.
parts: For I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: For I am the Lord who brings you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God.
parts: For I am the Lord who brings you up out of the land of Egypt, to be your God.

verses.text: ‘This is the law of the animals and the birds and every living creature that moves in the waters, and of every creature that creeps on the earth, to distinguish between the unclean and the clean, and between the animal that may be eaten and the animal that may not be eaten.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, saying to them, ‘If a woman conceived and bore a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days; she shall be unclean as in the days of her menstrual isolation.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, saying to them, ‘If a woman conceived and bore a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days; she shall be unclean as in the days of her menstrual isolation.

verses.text: Then on the eighth day, the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.
parts: Then on the eighth day, the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.

verses.text: She will then continue in the blood of her uncleanness thirty-three days.
parts: She will then continue in the blood of her uncleanness thirty-three days.

verses.text: But if she bears a female child, she will be unclean two weeks, as in her menstrual isolation, and she will continue in the blood of her uncleanness sixty-six days.
parts: But if she bears a female child, she will be unclean two weeks, as in her menstrual isolation, and she will continue in the blood of her uncleanness sixty-six days.

verses.text: When the days of her purification are fulfilled, whether for a son or a daughter, she is to bring to the priest a lamb of the first year as a whole burnt offering, and a young pigeon or a turtledove as a sin offering, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: When the days of her purification are fulfilled, whether for a son or a daughter, she is to bring to the priest a lamb of the first year as a whole burnt offering, and a young pigeon or a turtledove as a sin offering, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: Then he shall bring it before the Lord and make atonement for her, and it will cleanse her from her flow of blood.
parts: Then he shall bring it before the Lord and make atonement for her, and it will cleanse her from her flow of blood.

verses.text: But if she is unable to afford a lamb, she may bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons—one as a whole burnt offering and the other as a sin offering.
parts: But if she is unable to afford a lamb, she may bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons—one as a whole burnt offering and the other as a sin offering.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying, “When a man has a scar on the surface of his skin, or a shiny spot, and it appears to be a leprous infection, he is to be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons the priests. The priest shall examine the infection on the surface of his skin; and if the hair in the infection has turned white and the infection appears deeper than the surface of his skin, it is a leprous infection.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying, “When a man has a scar on the surface of his skin, or a shiny spot, and it appears to be a leprous infection, he is to be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons the priests.

The priest shall examine the infection on the surface of his skin; and if the hair in the infection has turned white and the infection appears deeper than the surface of his skin, it is a leprous infection.

verses.text: But if the shiny spot on the surface of his skin is white, but appears to be no more than skin deep, and its hair has not turned white, but is dark, the priest shall quarantine him for seven days.
parts: But if the shiny spot on the surface of his skin is white, but appears to be no more than skin deep, and its hair has not turned white, but is dark, the priest shall quarantine him for seven days.

verses.text: Then the priest shall examine him on the seventh day; and indeed, if the infection appears as it was, and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall quarantine him another seven days.
parts: Then the priest shall examine him on the seventh day; and indeed, if the infection appears as it was, and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall quarantine him another seven days.

verses.text: Then the priest shall examine him again on the seventh day; and indeed, if the infection is dark, and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is only a spot, and he shall wash his clothes and be clean.
parts: Then the priest shall examine him again on the seventh day; and indeed, if the infection is dark, and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is only a spot, and he shall wash his clothes and be clean.

verses.text: But if the spot happens to spread at all on the skin, after he was seen by the priest for his cleansing, then he must be seen by the priest again.
parts: But if the spot happens to spread at all on the skin, after he was seen by the priest for his cleansing, then he must be seen by the priest again.

verses.text: So if the priest sees the spot has indeed spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean.
parts: So if the priest sees the spot has indeed spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him unclean.

verses.text: “When the leprous infection is on a man, he shall be brought to the priest. The priest shall examine him; and indeed, if the scar on the skin is white, and has turned the hair white, and some of the flesh in the scar is healthy and alive, it is an old leprosy on the surface of his skin.
parts: “When the leprous infection is on a man, he shall be brought to the priest.

The priest shall examine him; and indeed, if the scar on the skin is white, and has turned the hair white, and some of the flesh in the scar is healthy and alive, it is an old leprosy on the surface of his skin.

verses.text: The priest shall examine him; and indeed, if the scar on the skin is white, and has turned the hair white, and some of the flesh in the scar is healthy and alive,
parts: The priest shall examine him; and indeed, if the scar on the skin is white, and has turned the hair white, and some of the flesh in the scar is healthy and alive,

verses.text: it is an old leprosy on the surface of his skin.
parts: it is an old leprosy on the surface of his skin.

verses.text: But if leprosy breaks out all over the skin, and it covers from head to foot all the skin of the one with the infection, according to the full examination of the priest,
parts: But if leprosy breaks out all over the skin, and it covers from head to foot all the skin of the one with the infection, according to the full examination of the priest,

verses.text: then the priest shall consider; and indeed, if the leprosy covers the entire surface of his skin, he shall pronounce clean him who has the infection; because it all turned white.
parts: then the priest shall consider; and indeed, if the leprosy covers the entire surface of his skin, he shall pronounce clean him who has the infection; because it all turned white.

verses.text: But in whatever day an open wound appears on him, he shall be unclean.
parts: But in whatever day an open wound appears on him, he shall be unclean.

verses.text: Thus the priest shall examine the open wound and pronounce him unclean; for an open wound is unclean; it is leprosy.

and for a leprous garment, a house, a scar, a mark, and a bright spot, to determine in which day there is the unclean, and in which day it will be declared clean.
