parts: and for a leprous garment, a house,

verses.text: a scar, a mark, and a bright spot,
parts: a scar, a mark, and a bright spot,

verses.text: to determine in which day there is the unclean, and in which day it will be declared clean.
parts: to determine in which day there is the unclean, and in which day it will be declared clean.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, to any and every man, ‘When any man has a seminal discharge from his body, his discharge is unclean.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, to any and every man, ‘When any man has a seminal discharge from his body, his discharge is unclean.

verses.text: This shall be the law of his uncleanness—whether his bodily member flows with an involuntary discharge of semen, or is stopped up by his discharge, it is his uncleanness.
parts: This shall be the law of his uncleanness—whether his bodily member flows with an involuntary discharge of semen, or is stopped up by his discharge, it is his uncleanness.

verses.text: Every bed on which he who has the discharge lies is unclean, and everything on which he sits shall be unclean.
parts: Every bed on which he who has the discharge lies is unclean, and everything on which he sits shall be unclean.

verses.text: Whoever touches his bed shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches his bed shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Whoever sits on anything on which he who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever sits on anything on which he who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Whoever touches the skin of him who has the discharge shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches the skin of him who has the discharge shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: If he who has the discharge spits on him who is clean, he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: If he who has the discharge spits on him who is clean, he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Any saddle of a donkey on which he who has the discharge rides shall be unclean until evening.
parts: Any saddle of a donkey on which he who has the discharge rides shall be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Whoever touches anything under him shall be unclean until evening; and whoever carries any of those things shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches anything under him shall be unclean until evening; and whoever carries any of those things shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Whomever he who has the discharge touches, and has not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whomever he who has the discharge touches, and has not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: An earthen vessel that he who has the discharge touches shall be broken, and every wooden vessel shall be rinsed in water.
parts: An earthen vessel that he who has the discharge touches shall be broken, and every wooden vessel shall be rinsed in water.

verses.text: ‘Now when he who has a discharge is cleansed of his discharge, he shall count for himself seven days for his cleansing.
parts: ‘Now when he who has a discharge is cleansed of his discharge, he shall count for himself seven days for his cleansing.

verses.text: On the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring these before the Lord, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, and give them to the priest.
parts: On the eighth day he shall take for himself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring these before the Lord, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, and give them to the priest.

verses.text: Then the priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering.
parts: Then the priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering.

verses.text: ‘If any man has an emission of semen, he shall wash all his body in water and be unclean until evening.
parts: ‘If any man has an emission of semen, he shall wash all his body in water and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Any garment and any leather on which there is semen shall be washed with water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Any garment and any leather on which there is semen shall be washed with water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Also, when a woman lies with a man and there is an emission of semen, they shall bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Also, when a woman lies with a man and there is an emission of semen, they shall bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: ‘If a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she shall be in her menstrual period seven days; and whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.
parts: ‘If a woman has a discharge, and the discharge from her body is blood, she shall be in her menstrual period seven days; and whoever touches her shall be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Everything she lies on during her menstruation shall be unclean; also everything she sits on shall be unclean.
parts: Everything she lies on during her menstruation shall be unclean; also everything she sits on shall be unclean.

verses.text: Whoever touches her bed shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches her bed shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: Whoever touches anything she sat on shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches anything she sat on shall wash his clothes and bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: If anything is on her bed, or on anything on which she sits, when he touches it, he shall be unclean until evening.
parts: If anything is on her bed, or on anything on which she sits, when he touches it, he shall be unclean until evening.

verses.text: If any man lies with her, and her uncleanness is on him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed on which he lies shall be unclean.
parts: If any man lies with her, and her uncleanness is on him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed on which he lies shall be unclean.

verses.text: ‘If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days, other than at the time of her menstruation, or if it runs beyond this time, all the days of her unclean discharge shall be as the days of her menstruation.
parts: ‘If a woman has a discharge of blood for many days, other than at the time of her menstruation, or if it runs beyond this time, all the days of her unclean discharge shall be as the days of her menstruation.

verses.text: Every bed on which she lies all the days of her discharge shall be to her as the bed of her menstruation; and whatever she sits on, it shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her menstruation.
parts: Every bed on which she lies all the days of her discharge shall be to her as the bed of her menstruation; and whatever she sits on, it shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her menstruation.

verses.text: Whoever touches her shall be unclean; and he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: Whoever touches her shall be unclean; and he shall wash his clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: But if she is cleansed of her discharge, she shall count for herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
parts: But if she is cleansed of her discharge, she shall count for herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

verses.text: Then on the eighth day she shall take for herself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: Then on the eighth day she shall take for herself two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering, and the priest shall make atonement for her before the Lord because of the discharge of her uncleanness.
parts: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a whole burnt offering, and the priest shall make atonement for her before the Lord because of the discharge of her uncleanness.

verses.text: ‘Thus you shall make the children of Israel ungodly because of their uncleanness, lest they die in their uncleanness when they defile My tabernacle among them. This is the law for one who has a discharge and who emits semen and is unclean thereby, and for her who is indisposed because of her menstrual period, and for one who has a discharge, either man or woman, and for the man who lies with her during her menstrual period.’ ”
parts: ‘Thus you shall make the children of Israel ungodly because of their uncleanness, lest they die in their uncleanness when they defile My tabernacle among them.

This is the law for one who has a discharge and who emits semen and is unclean thereby, and for her who is indisposed because of her menstrual period, and for one who has a discharge, either man or woman, and for the man who lies with her during her menstrual period.’ ”

verses.text: This is the law for one who has a discharge and who emits semen and is unclean thereby,
parts: This is the law for one who has a discharge and who emits semen and is unclean thereby,

verses.text: and for her who is indisposed because of her menstrual period, and for one who has a discharge, either man or woman, and for the man who lies with her during her menstrual period.’ ”
parts: and for her who is indisposed because of her menstrual period, and for one who has a discharge, either man or woman, and for the man who lies with her during her menstrual period.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron's two sons, when they offered strange fire before the Lord and died; and the Lord said to Moses, “Tell Aaron your brother not to come at just any time into the holy place inside the veil, in the presence of the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony, lest he die; for I will be seen in the cloud above the mercy seat. Thus Aaron shall come into the holy place with a young bull of the oxen as a sin offering, and a ram as a whole burnt offering. He shall put the holy linen tunic and the linen trousers on his body; he shall be girded with a linen sash, and with the linen turban he shall be attired.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron's two sons, when they offered strange fire before the Lord and died;

and the Lord said to Moses, “Tell Aaron your brother not to come at just any time into the holy place inside the veil, in the presence of the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony, lest he die; for I will be seen in the cloud above the mercy seat.
Thus Aaron shall come into the holy place with a young bull of the oxen as a sin offering, and a ram as a whole burnt offering.
He shall put the holy linen tunic and the linen trousers on his body; he shall be girded with a linen sash, and with the linen turban he shall be attired.

verses.text: “Then he shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats as a sin offering, and one ram as a whole burnt offering. Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house. He shall take the two kids and present them before the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: “Then he shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats as a sin offering, and one ram as a whole burnt offering.
Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house.
He shall take the two kids and present them before the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house.
parts: Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house.

verses.text: He shall take the two kids and present them before the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.
parts: He shall take the two kids and present them before the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony.

verses.text: Then Aaron shall cast lots for the two kids: one lot for the Lord and the other lot for the scapegoat.
parts: Then Aaron shall cast lots for the two kids: one lot for the Lord and the other lot for the scapegoat.

verses.text: Aaron shall bring the kid on which the Lord's lot fell and offer it as a sin offering.
parts: Aaron shall bring the kid on which the Lord's lot fell and offer it as a sin offering.

verses.text: But the kid on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the Lord, to make atonement upon it, to let it go as the scapegoat into the desert.
parts: But the kid on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the Lord, to make atonement upon it, to let it go as the scapegoat into the desert.

verses.text: “Then Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house.
parts: “Then Aaron shall offer the young bull as his sin offering, to make atonement for himself and his house.

verses.text: He shall then take a censer full of burning coals of fire from the altar before the Lord, with his hands full of the incense compound, beaten fine, and bring it inside the veil.
parts: He shall then take a censer full of burning coals of fire from the altar before the Lord, with his hands full of the incense compound, beaten fine, and bring it inside the veil.

verses.text: He shall put the incense on the fire before the Lord, that the cloud of incense may cover the mercy seat on the testimonies, lest he die.
parts: He shall put the incense on the fire before the Lord, that the cloud of incense may cover the mercy seat on the testimonies, lest he die.

verses.text: He shall take some of the young bull's blood with his finger and sprinkle it upon the east side of the mercy seat seven times.
parts: He shall take some of the young bull's blood with his finger and sprinkle it upon the east side of the mercy seat seven times.

verses.text: “After that, he shall kill the kid of the sin offering before the Lord on behalf of the people, and bring some of its blood inside the veil, do with that blood as he did with the blood of the young bull, and sprinkle it upon the east side of the mercy seat seven times.
parts: “After that, he shall kill the kid of the sin offering before the Lord on behalf of the people, and bring some of its blood inside the veil, do with that blood as he did with the blood of the young bull, and sprinkle it upon the east side of the mercy seat seven times.

verses.text: So he shall make atonement in the holy place because of the impurities and injustices of the children of Israel, for all their sins; and thus he shall do this in the tabernacle of testimony, built among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
parts: So he shall make atonement in the holy place because of the impurities and injustices of the children of Israel, for all their sins; and thus he shall do this in the tabernacle of testimony, built among them in the midst of their uncleanness.

verses.text: There shall be no man in the tabernacle of testimony when he goes in to make atonement in the holy place, until he comes out, that he may make atonement for himself, his household, and all the congregation of the children of Israel.
parts: There shall be no man in the tabernacle of testimony when he goes in to make atonement in the holy place, until he comes out, that he may make atonement for himself, his household, and all the congregation of the children of Israel.

verses.text: Then he shall go out to the altar before the Lord and make atonement upon it; and he shall take some of the blood of both the young bull and the kid and put it on the horns of the altar all around.
parts: Then he shall go out to the altar before the Lord and make atonement upon it; and he shall take some of the blood of both the young bull and the kid and put it on the horns of the altar all around.

verses.text: Then he shall sprinkle some of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse and sanctify it because of the impurities of the children of Israel.
parts: Then he shall sprinkle some of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse and sanctify it because of the impurities of the children of Israel.

verses.text: “When Aaron shall finish making atonement in the holy place, the tabernacle of testimony and the altar, and shall also cleanse matters concerning the priests, then he shall bring the living kid.
parts: “When Aaron shall finish making atonement in the holy place, the tabernacle of testimony and the altar, and shall also cleanse matters concerning the priests, then he shall bring the living kid.

verses.text: Aaron shall place his hands on the head of the living kid, confess over it all the transgressions of the children of Israel, and all their lawlessness, and all their sins; and he shall put them on the head of the living kid, and send it away into the desert by the hand of a suitable man.
parts: Aaron shall place his hands on the head of the living kid, confess over it all the transgressions of the children of Israel, and all their lawlessness, and all their sins; and he shall put them on the head of the living kid, and send it away into the desert by the hand of a suitable man.

verses.text: The kid shall bear on itself all their wrongdoings to an uninhabited land.
parts: The kid shall bear on itself all their wrongdoings to an uninhabited land.

verses.text: Then Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of testimony and take off the linen garments he put on when he went into the holy place; and he shall leave them there.
parts: Then Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of testimony and take off the linen garments he put on when he went into the holy place; and he shall leave them there.

verses.text: He shall then wash his body with water in a holy place, put on his garments, and come out to offer his whole burnt offering and the whole burnt offering of the people, to make atonement for himself, his house, the people, and in matters concerning the priests.
parts: He shall then wash his body with water in a holy place, put on his garments, and come out to offer his whole burnt offering and the whole burnt offering of the people, to make atonement for himself, his house, the people, and in matters concerning the priests.

verses.text: The fat of the sin offering he shall offer on the altar.
parts: The fat of the sin offering he shall offer on the altar.

verses.text: He who sent away the kid which was set apart for remission shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.
parts: He who sent away the kid which was set apart for remission shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward he may come into the camp.

verses.text: The young bull and the kid for the sin offerings whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place shall be carried outside the camp; and they shall burn them in the fire: their skin, their flesh, and their offal.
parts: The young bull and the kid for the sin offerings whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place shall be carried outside the camp; and they shall burn them in the fire: their skin, their flesh, and their offal.

verses.text: Then he who burns them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; and afterward, he may come into the camp.
parts: Then he who burns them shall wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; and afterward, he may come into the camp.

verses.text: “This shall be an ordinance forever for you: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall humble your souls, and do no work at all, whether a native of your own country or a resident alien who dwells among you.
parts: “This shall be an ordinance forever for you: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall humble your souls, and do no work at all, whether a native of your own country or a resident alien who dwells among you.

verses.text: For on that day the priest shall make atonement for you, to cleanse you from all your sins before the Lord.
parts: For on that day the priest shall make atonement for you, to cleanse you from all your sins before the Lord.

verses.text: It is a Sabbath of Sabbaths, a rest for you, and you shall humble your souls.
parts: It is a Sabbath of Sabbaths, a rest for you, and you shall humble your souls.

verses.text: So the priest who is anointed and consecrated to minister as priest in his father's place shall make atonement and put on the linen clothes, the holy garments.
parts: So the priest who is anointed and consecrated to minister as priest in his father's place shall make atonement and put on the linen clothes, the holy garments.

verses.text: Then he shall make atonement in the most holy place, the tabernacle of testimony and the altar; and he shall make atonement for matters concerning the priests and all the congregation.
parts: Then he shall make atonement in the most holy place, the tabernacle of testimony and the altar; and he shall make atonement for matters concerning the priests and all the congregation.

verses.text: So this shall be an ordinance forever for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel, for all their sins; and he shall do this once a year,” as the Lord gave orders to Moses.
parts: So this shall be an ordinance forever for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel, for all their sins; and he shall do this once a year,” as the Lord gave orders to Moses.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘This is the thing the Lord commanded, saying, “Whatever man of the children of Israel, or resident aliens dwelling among them, kills a young bull, a sheep, or a goat in the camp, or kills it outside the camp, and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it as a whole burnt offering or a peace offering to the Lord, acceptable for a sweet aroma; and whatever man kills outside and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, so as to offer it as a gift to the Lord before the Lord's tabernacle, blood shall be reckoned to that man, for he has shed blood; and that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people, that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices they kill in the fields to the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to the priest, and offer them as peace offerings to the Lord.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘This is the thing the Lord commanded, saying, “Whatever man of the children of Israel, or resident aliens dwelling among them, kills a young bull, a sheep, or a goat in the camp, or kills it outside the camp, and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it as a whole burnt offering or a peace offering to the Lord, acceptable for a sweet aroma; and whatever man kills outside and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, so as to offer it as a gift to the Lord before the Lord's tabernacle, blood shall be reckoned to that man, for he has shed blood; and that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people, that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices they kill in the fields to the Lord at the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to the priest, and offer them as peace offerings to the Lord.

verses.text: The priest shall pour the blood upon the altar all around before the Lord at the doors of the tabernacle of testimony, and offer the fat for a sweet aroma to the Lord.
parts: The priest shall pour the blood upon the altar all around before the Lord at the doors of the tabernacle of testimony, and offer the fat for a sweet aroma to the Lord.

verses.text: They shall no more offer their sacrifices to worthless things, after whom they prostituted themselves.
parts: They shall no more offer their sacrifices to worthless things, after whom they prostituted themselves.

verses.text: “Also you shall say to them, ‘Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens who dwell among you, offers a whole burnt offering or sacrifice and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it to the Lord, that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people.
parts: “Also you shall say to them, ‘Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens who dwell among you, offers a whole burnt offering or sacrifice
and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it to the Lord, that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people.

verses.text: and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it to the Lord, that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people.
parts: and does not bring it to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, to offer it to the Lord, that man shall be utterly destroyed from among his people.

verses.text: ‘And whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among you, eats any blood, I will set My face against that soul who eats blood and will utterly destroy him from among his people.
parts: ‘And whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among you, eats any blood, I will set My face against that soul who eats blood and will utterly destroy him from among his people.

verses.text: For the life of all flesh is in its blood, and I give it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for its blood makes atonement for the soul.’
parts: For the life of all flesh is in its blood, and I give it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for its blood makes atonement for the soul.’

verses.text: “Therefore, I said to the children of Israel, ‘No one among you shall eat blood, nor shall any resident alien who dwells among you eat blood.’
parts: “Therefore, I said to the children of Israel, ‘No one among you shall eat blood, nor shall any resident alien who dwells among you eat blood.’

verses.text: Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among you, hunts and catches any animal or bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with dirt;
parts: Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among you, hunts and catches any animal or bird that may be eaten, he shall pour out its blood and cover it with dirt;

verses.text: for the life of all flesh is its blood.
parts: for the life of all flesh is its blood.

verses.text: “Every soul who eats what died naturally or what was torn by wild animals, whether a native of your own country or a resident alien, he shall both wash his clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
parts: “Every soul who eats what died naturally or what was torn by wild animals, whether a native of your own country or a resident alien, he shall both wash his clothes, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.

verses.text: But if he does not both wash his body and bathe in water, he shall bear his guilt.”
parts: But if he does not both wash his body and bathe in water, he shall bear his guilt.”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘I am the Lord your God.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: According to the way of life in the land of Egypt, where you dwelt, you shall not do; and according to the way of life in the land of Canaan, where I bring you, you shall not do; nor shall you walk in their ordinances.
parts: According to the way of life in the land of Egypt, where you dwelt, you shall not do; and according to the way of life in the land of Canaan, where I bring you, you shall not do; nor shall you walk in their ordinances.

verses.text: You shall do My judgments and keep My ordinances, to walk in them: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall do My judgments and keep My ordinances, to walk in them: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and My judgments, and do these, which if a man does, he shall live by them; I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and My judgments, and do these, which if a man does, he shall live by them; I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: None of you shall approach anyone who is near of kin to him, to uncover his nakedness: I am the Lord.
parts: None of you shall approach anyone who is near of kin to him, to uncover his nakedness: I am the Lord.

verses.text: The nakedness of your father or mother you shall not uncover.
parts: The nakedness of your father or mother you shall not uncover.

verses.text: The nakedness of your father's wife you shall not uncover; it is your father's nakedness.
parts: The nakedness of your father's wife you shall not uncover; it is your father's nakedness.

verses.text: The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or elsewhere, her nakedness you shall not uncover.
parts: The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or elsewhere, her nakedness you shall not uncover.

verses.text: The nakedness of your son's daughter, or your daughter's daughter, their nakedness you shall not uncover; for theirs is your own nakedness.
parts: The nakedness of your son's daughter, or your daughter's daughter, their nakedness you shall not uncover; for theirs is your own nakedness.

verses.text: The nakedness of your father's wife's daughter, begotten by your father—she is your sister—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
parts: The nakedness of your father's wife's daughter, begotten by your father—she is your sister—you shall not uncover her nakedness.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister; she is near of kin to your father.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister; she is near of kin to your father.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother's sister, for she is near of kin to your mother.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother's sister, for she is near of kin to your mother.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's brother, and approach his wife; she is your aunt.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's brother, and approach his wife; she is your aunt.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law—she is your son's wife—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law—she is your son's wife—you shall not uncover her nakedness.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother's wife; it is your brother's nakedness.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother's wife; it is your brother's nakedness.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, nor shall you take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover their nakedness.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, nor shall you take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover their nakedness.

verses.text: Nor shall you take a woman as a rival to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the other is alive.
parts: Nor shall you take a woman as a rival to her sister, to uncover her nakedness while the other is alive.

verses.text: ‘Also you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness as long as she is in her menstrual period of uncleanness.
parts: ‘Also you shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness as long as she is in her menstrual period of uncleanness.

verses.text: Moreover, you shall not lie carnally with your neighbor's wife, to defile yourself with her.
parts: Moreover, you shall not lie carnally with your neighbor's wife, to defile yourself with her.

verses.text: Furthermore, you shall not give your offspring to worship a ruler, nor shall you defile My holy name: I am the Lord.
parts: Furthermore, you shall not give your offspring to worship a ruler, nor shall you defile My holy name: I am the Lord.

verses.text: You shall not lie with a male as with a woman.
parts: You shall not lie with a male as with a woman.

verses.text: Nor shall you mate with any animal, to defile yourself with it.
parts: Nor shall you mate with any animal, to defile yourself with it.

verses.text: ‘Do not defile yourselves with any of these things; for by all these ways of life the nations are defiled, which I am casting out before your face.
parts: ‘Do not defile yourselves with any of these things; for by all these ways of life the nations are defiled, which I am casting out before your face.

verses.text: For the land is defiled, and on its account I am repaying them for their wrongdoing.
parts: For the land is defiled, and on its account I am repaying them for their wrongdoing.

verses.text: You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and My judgments and shall not do any of these abominations, either any of your own nation or any resident alien who dwells among you
parts: You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and My judgments and shall not do any of these abominations, either any of your own nation or any resident alien who dwells among you

verses.text: (for the men of the land before you did all these abominations, and thus the land was defiled),
parts: (for the men of the land before you did all these abominations, and thus the land was defiled),

verses.text: that the land not be vexed with you in your defilement of it, as it was vexed with the nations before you.
parts: that the land not be vexed with you in your defilement of it, as it was vexed with the nations before you.

verses.text: For whoever does any of these abominations, these souls shall be utterly destroyed from among their people.
parts: For whoever does any of these abominations, these souls shall be utterly destroyed from among their people.

verses.text: Therefore, you shall keep My ordinances, so as not to do any of these abominable customs which were committed before you, and not to defile yourselves by them; for I am the Lord your God.’ ”
parts: Therefore, you shall keep My ordinances, so as not to do any of these abominable customs which were committed before you, and not to defile yourselves by them; for I am the Lord your God.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel and say to them, ‘You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
“Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel and say to them, ‘You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.

verses.text: Every one of you shall reverence his father and mother and keep My Sabbaths: I am the Lord your God.
parts: Every one of you shall reverence his father and mother and keep My Sabbaths: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: Do not follow idols, nor make for yourselves molten gods: I am the Lord your God.
parts: Do not follow idols, nor make for yourselves molten gods: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: And if you offer a sacrifice of a peace offering to the Lord, you shall offer it in a manner acceptable for you.
parts: And if you offer a sacrifice of a peace offering to the Lord, you shall offer it in a manner acceptable for you.

verses.text: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day, and if any remains until the third day, it shall be burned in the fire.
parts: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day, and if any remains until the third day, it shall be burned in the fire.

verses.text: And if it is eaten at all on the third day, it is not fit to be offered.
parts: And if it is eaten at all on the third day, it is not fit to be offered.

verses.text: Therefore, everyone who eats it shall bear his guilt, because he has defiled the holy things of the Lord; and the souls that eat it shall be utterly destroyed from among their people.
parts: Therefore, everyone who eats it shall bear his guilt, because he has defiled the holy things of the Lord; and the souls that eat it shall be utterly destroyed from among their people.

verses.text: ‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
parts: ‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.

verses.text: Also you shall not glean your vineyard, nor shall you gather every grape of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the resident alien: I am the Lord your God.
parts: Also you shall not glean your vineyard, nor shall you gather every grape of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the resident alien: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: ‘You shall not steal, nor deal falsely, nor lie to one another.
parts: ‘You shall not steal, nor deal falsely, nor lie to one another.

verses.text: You shall not swear by My name unjustly, nor shall you defile the name of your God: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not swear by My name unjustly, nor shall you defile the name of your God: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall not treat your neighbor unjustly, nor rob him.
parts: You shall not treat your neighbor unjustly, nor rob him.

verses.text: You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shall fear your God: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind, but shall fear your God: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: ‘You shall do no injustice in judgment.
parts: ‘You shall do no injustice in judgment.

verses.text: You shall not go about deceitfully among your people; nor shall you take a stand against the life of your neighbor: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not go about deceitfully among your people; nor shall you take a stand against the life of your neighbor: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall not hate your brother in your mind.
parts: You shall not hate your brother in your mind.

verses.text: You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the Lord.
parts: You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people, but you shall love your neighbor as yourself: I am the Lord.

verses.text: ‘You shall keep My law.
parts: ‘You shall keep My law.

verses.text: ‘Whoever lies carnally with a woman who is betrothed to a man as a concubine and has not at all been redeemed nor given her freedom, for this there shall be an inquiry; but they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
parts: ‘Whoever lies carnally with a woman who is betrothed to a man as a concubine and has not at all been redeemed nor given her freedom, for this there shall be an inquiry; but they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

verses.text: Then he shall bring his trespass offering to the Lord, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, a ram as a trespass offering.
parts: Then he shall bring his trespass offering to the Lord, to the door of the tabernacle of testimony, a ram as a trespass offering.

verses.text: The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the Lord for the sin he committed; and the sin he committed shall be remitted him.
parts: The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the Lord for the sin he committed; and the sin he committed shall be remitted him.

verses.text: ‘When you come into the land the Lord your God gives you and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall cleanse its impurity.
parts: ‘When you come into the land the Lord your God gives you and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall cleanse its impurity.

verses.text: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, a praise to the Lord.
parts: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, a praise to the Lord.

verses.text: Then in the fifth year you may eat its fruit, that it may yield to you its increase: I am the Lord your God.
parts: Then in the fifth year you may eat its fruit, that it may yield to you its increase: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: ‘You shall not eat upon the mountains, nor divine for omens, nor watch birds for omens.
parts: ‘You shall not eat upon the mountains, nor divine for omens, nor watch birds for omens.

verses.text: You shall not shave around the sides of your head, nor shall you disfigure the edges of your beard.
parts: You shall not shave around the sides of your head, nor shall you disfigure the edges of your beard.

verses.text: You shall not make any gashing on your bodies for the dead, nor tattoo any marks on you: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not make any gashing on your bodies for the dead, nor tattoo any marks on you: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: Do not defile your daughter, to cause her to commit fornication, lest the land fall into fornication, and the land become full of lawlessness.
parts: Do not defile your daughter, to cause her to commit fornication, lest the land fall into fornication, and the land become full of lawlessness.

verses.text: ‘You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My holy things: I am the Lord.
parts: ‘You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My holy things: I am the Lord.

verses.text: You shall not follow ventriloquists, nor attach yourselves to enchanters, to be defiled by them: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not follow ventriloquists, nor attach yourselves to enchanters, to be defiled by them: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall rise before the gray-headed and honor the presence of an old man, and fear your God: I am the Lord your God.
parts: You shall rise before the gray-headed and honor the presence of an old man, and fear your God: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: And if a resident alien dwells with you in your land, you shall not mistreat him.
parts: And if a resident alien dwells with you in your land, you shall not mistreat him.

verses.text: The resident alien who dwells among you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you were resident aliens in the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
parts: The resident alien who dwells among you shall be to you as one born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you were resident aliens in the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall do no injustice in judgment, in measurement of length, weight, or balances.
parts: You shall do no injustice in judgment, in measurement of length, weight, or balances.

verses.text: You shall have honest scales, honest weights, and honest measures: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt.
parts: You shall have honest scales, honest weights, and honest measures: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt.

verses.text: ‘Therefore you shall keep all My law and all My ordinances, and perform them: I am the Lord your God.’ ”
parts: ‘Therefore you shall keep all My law and all My ordinances, and perform them: I am the Lord your God.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Again, you shall say to the children of Israel, ‘Whoever of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling in Israel, gives any of his children to worship a ruler, let him be put to death.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

“Again, you shall say to the children of Israel, ‘Whoever of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling in Israel, gives any of his children to worship a ruler, let him be put to death.

verses.text: I will set My face against that man and will destroy him from among his people, because he gave his children to a ruler, to defile My holy things and profane the name of those sanctified for Me.
parts: I will set My face against that man and will destroy him from among his people, because he gave his children to a ruler, to defile My holy things and profane the name of those sanctified for Me.

verses.text: But if the natives of the land disregard that man, taking no notice of him when he gives his children to a ruler, and they do not kill him,
parts: But if the natives of the land disregard that man, taking no notice of him when he gives his children to a ruler, and they do not kill him,

verses.text: then I will set My face against that man and those of his kind.
parts: then I will set My face against that man and those of his kind.

verses.text: Also the soul who follows ventriloquists and charmers, to prostitute himself with them, I will set My face against that soul and destroy him from among his people.
parts: Also the soul who follows ventriloquists and charmers, to prostitute himself with them, I will set My face against that soul and destroy him from among his people.

verses.text: Therefore, you shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.
parts: Therefore, you shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy.

verses.text: You shall keep My ordinances and perform them: I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
parts: You shall keep My ordinances and perform them: I am the Lord who sanctifies you.

verses.text: Whatever man curses his father or mother shall surely be put to death.
parts: Whatever man curses his father or mother shall surely be put to death.

verses.text: ‘The man who commits adultery with another man's wife, or who commits adultery with his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.
parts: ‘The man who commits adultery with another man's wife, or who commits adultery with his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.

verses.text: The man who lies with his father's wife has uncovered his father's nakedness; both shall surely be put to death, for they are guilty.
parts: The man who lies with his father's wife has uncovered his father's nakedness; both shall surely be put to death, for they are guilty.

verses.text: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both shall surely be put to death.
parts: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both shall surely be put to death.

verses.text: If a man lies with a male as he lies with a woman, both committed an abomination.
parts: If a man lies with a male as he lies with a woman, both committed an abomination.

verses.text: If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is wickedness.
parts: If a man marries a woman and her mother, it is wickedness.

verses.text: If a man mates with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.
parts: If a man mates with an animal, he shall surely be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.

verses.text: If a woman approaches any animal and mates with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal.
parts: If a woman approaches any animal and mates with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal.

verses.text: ‘If a man takes his sister, his father's daughter or his mother's daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness, it is a reproach.
parts: ‘If a man takes his sister, his father's daughter or his mother's daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness, it is a reproach.

verses.text: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and uncovers her nakedness, he has exposed her flow, and she has uncovered the flow of her blood.
parts: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and uncovers her nakedness, he has exposed her flow, and she has uncovered the flow of her blood.

verses.text: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister, nor your mother's sister, for that would uncover his near of kin.
parts: You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father's sister, nor your mother's sister, for that would uncover his near of kin.

verses.text: If a man lies with his close relative, he has uncovered his relative's nakedness.
parts: If a man lies with his close relative, he has uncovered his relative's nakedness.

verses.text: If a man takes his brother's wife, it is uncleanness.
parts: If a man takes his brother's wife, it is uncleanness.

verses.text: ‘You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and all My judgments and perform them, that the land to which I am bringing you to dwell in not be provoked at you.
parts: ‘You shall therefore keep all My ordinances and all My judgments and perform them, that the land to which I am bringing you to dwell in not be provoked at you.

verses.text: Also, you shall not walk in the ordinances of the nations I am casting out before you; for they commit all these things, and therefore I abhor them.
parts: Also, you shall not walk in the ordinances of the nations I am casting out before you; for they commit all these things, and therefore I abhor them.

verses.text: But I said to you, “You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey.” I am the Lord your God, who separated you from all peoples.
parts: But I said to you, “You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey.” I am the Lord your God, who separated you from all peoples.

verses.text: You shall therefore distinguish between clean animals and unclean, between unclean birds and clean, and you shall not make your souls abominable by animals or birds, or by any kind of living thing that creeps on the ground, which I separated from you as unclean.
parts: You shall therefore distinguish between clean animals and unclean, between unclean birds and clean, and you shall not make your souls abominable by animals or birds, or by any kind of living thing that creeps on the ground, which I separated from you as unclean.

verses.text: You shall be holy to Me, for I, the Lord your God, who separated you from all peoples for Myself, am holy.
parts: You shall be holy to Me, for I, the Lord your God, who separated you from all peoples for Myself, am holy.

verses.text: ‘A man or a woman who is a ventriloquist or a charmer shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones, for they are guilty.’ ”
parts: ‘A man or a woman who is a ventriloquist or a charmer shall surely be put to death; they shall stone them with stones, for they are guilty.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, ‘They shall not be defiled by the dead among their people, except for their nearest relatives: their father, mother, sons, daughters, brother, and virgin sister near to him and having no husband; for these he may be defiled.
parts: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, ‘They shall not be defiled by the dead among their people,
except for their nearest relatives: their father, mother, sons, daughters, brother, and virgin sister near to him and having no husband; for these he may be defiled.

verses.text: Otherwise, he shall not be unexpectedly defiled and profaned among his people.
parts: Otherwise, he shall not be unexpectedly defiled and profaned among his people.

verses.text: You shall not shave a bald spot on your head for the dead, nor shall they shave the edges of their beard, nor make any cuttings on their flesh.
parts: You shall not shave a bald spot on your head for the dead, nor shall they shave the edges of their beard, nor make any cuttings on their flesh.

verses.text: They shall be holy to their God, and not defile the name of their God, for they offer the sacrifices of the Lord as the gifts of their God; therefore, they shall be holy.
parts: They shall be holy to their God, and not defile the name of their God, for they offer the sacrifices of the Lord as the gifts of their God; therefore, they shall be holy.

verses.text: They shall not take a wife who is a prostitute and defiled, nor shall they take a woman divorced from her husband; for a priest is holy to the Lord his God.
parts: They shall not take a wife who is a prostitute and defiled, nor shall they take a woman divorced from her husband; for a priest is holy to the Lord his God.

verses.text: Therefore you shall sanctify him, for he offers the gifts of the Lord your God.
parts: Therefore you shall sanctify him, for he offers the gifts of the Lord your God.

verses.text: The daughter of any priest, if she defiles herself by playing the harlot, she defiles the name of her father.
parts: The daughter of any priest, if she defiles herself by playing the harlot, she defiles the name of her father.

verses.text: The high priest who is great among his brethren, on whose head the anointing oil was poured and who was consecrated to wear the garments, shall not uncover his head nor tear his clothes;
parts: The high priest who is great among his brethren, on whose head the anointing oil was poured and who was consecrated to wear the garments, shall not uncover his head nor tear his clothes;

verses.text: nor shall he go near any soul who died, nor defile himself for his father or mother;
parts: nor shall he go near any soul who died, nor defile himself for his father or mother;

verses.text: nor shall he go out of the holy places, nor defile the sanctified place of his God; for the consecration of God's holy anointing oil is upon him: I am the Lord.
parts: nor shall he go out of the holy places, nor defile the sanctified place of his God; for the consecration of God's holy anointing oil is upon him: I am the Lord.

verses.text: Moreover, he shall take a wife in her virginity.
parts: Moreover, he shall take a wife in her virginity.

verses.text: But a widow, a divorced woman, a defiled woman, or a prostitute—these he shall not marry; but he shall take a virgin of his own people as wife.
parts: But a widow, a divorced woman, a defiled woman, or a prostitute—these he shall not marry; but he shall take a virgin of his own people as wife.

verses.text: Nor shall he defile his seed among his people, for I the Lord sanctify him.’ ”
parts: Nor shall he defile his seed among his people, for I the Lord sanctify him.’ ”

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to Aaron, saying, ‘No man of your descendants in succeeding generations who has any defect may approach to offer the gifts of his God. For any man who has a defect shall not approach: a man lame or blind, who has a slit nose or ear, a man who has a broken hand or foot, or is a hunchback or has a defect in his eye, or an inflammation with respect to the eyes, or a man who has a severe itch or a single testicle.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to Aaron, saying, ‘No man of your descendants in succeeding generations who has any defect may approach to offer the gifts of his God.

For any man who has a defect shall not approach: a man lame or blind, who has a slit nose or ear, a man who has a broken hand or foot, or is a hunchback or has a defect in his eye, or an inflammation with respect to the eyes, or a man who has a severe itch or a single testicle.

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron, saying, ‘No man of your descendants in succeeding generations who has any defect may approach to offer the gifts of his God.
parts: “Speak to Aaron, saying, ‘No man of your descendants in succeeding generations who has any defect may approach to offer the gifts of his God.

verses.text: For any man who has a defect shall not approach: a man lame or blind, who has a slit nose or ear,
parts: For any man who has a defect shall not approach: a man lame or blind, who has a slit nose or ear,

verses.text: a man who has a broken hand or foot,
parts: a man who has a broken hand or foot,

verses.text: or is a hunchback or has a defect in his eye, or an inflammation with respect to the eyes, or a man who has a severe itch or a single testicle.
parts: or is a hunchback or has a defect in his eye, or an inflammation with respect to the eyes, or a man who has a severe itch or a single testicle.

verses.text: No man of the seed of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall come near to offer the sacrifices to your God.
parts: No man of the seed of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall come near to offer the sacrifices to your God.

verses.text: The gifts of his God are most holy, and he may eat only the holy things;
parts: The gifts of his God are most holy, and he may eat only the holy things;

verses.text: but he shall not go near the veil or approach the altar, because he has a defect, lest he defile the holy place of his God; for I the Lord sanctify them.’ ”
parts: but he shall not go near the veil or approach the altar, because he has a defect, lest he defile the holy place of his God; for I the Lord sanctify them.’ ”

verses.text: Thus Moses told this to Aaron and his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
parts: Thus Moses told this to Aaron and his sons, and to all the children of Israel.

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Tell Aaron and his sons to be careful for the holy things of the children of Israel, in what is sanctified to Me, so as not to defile My holy name: I am the Lord.
parts: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
“Tell Aaron and his sons to be careful for the holy things of the children of Israel, in what is sanctified to Me, so as not to defile My holy name: I am the Lord.

verses.text: Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, whoever of your seed goes near the holy things the children of Israel sanctify to the Lord while his uncleanness is upon him, that soul shall be utterly destroyed by Me: I am the Lord your God.
parts: Say to them, ‘Throughout your generations, whoever of your seed goes near the holy things the children of Israel sanctify to the Lord while his uncleanness is upon him, that soul shall be utterly destroyed by Me: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: Whatever man of the seed of Aaron who is a leper or has an involuntary discharge of semen shall not eat the holy offerings until he is clean.
parts: Whatever man of the seed of Aaron who is a leper or has an involuntary discharge of semen shall not eat the holy offerings until he is clean.

verses.text: or whoever touches any unclean creeping thing by which he would be defiled, or anyone by whom he would be defiled, whatever his uncleanness may be—
parts: or whoever touches any unclean creeping thing by which he would be defiled, or anyone by whom he would be defiled, whatever his uncleanness may be—

verses.text: the soul who has touched any such thing shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he washes his body with water.
parts: the soul who has touched any such thing shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he washes his body with water.

verses.text: Thus when the sun goes down, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the holy things, because it is his food.
parts: Thus when the sun goes down, he shall be clean; and afterward he may eat of the holy things, because it is his food.

verses.text: Whatever dies naturally or is torn by wild animals he shall not eat, to defile himself with it: I am the Lord.
parts: Whatever dies naturally or is torn by wild animals he shall not eat, to defile himself with it: I am the Lord.

verses.text: They shall therefore keep My ordinances, lest they bear sin for it and die thereby, if they defile these.
parts: They shall therefore keep My ordinances, lest they bear sin for it and die thereby, if they defile these.

verses.text: No foreigner shall eat the holy things; one who sojourns with the priest or a hired servant shall not eat the holy things.
parts: No foreigner shall eat the holy things; one who sojourns with the priest or a hired servant shall not eat the holy things.

verses.text: But if the priest buys a soul with his money, this one may eat the priest's food; and one who is born in his house may eat his food.
parts: But if the priest buys a soul with his money, this one may eat the priest's food; and one who is born in his house may eat his food.

verses.text: If the priest's daughter is married to a foreigner, she may not eat of the holy offerings.
parts: If the priest's daughter is married to a foreigner, she may not eat of the holy offerings.

verses.text: But if the priest's daughter is a widow or divorced and has no child, and has returned to her father's house as in her youth, she may eat her father's food; but no foreigner shall eat it.
parts: But if the priest's daughter is a widow or divorced and has no child, and has returned to her father's house as in her youth, she may eat her father's food; but no foreigner shall eat it.

verses.text: Also, if a man eats the holy things in ignorance, then he shall restore the holy thing to the priest and add one-fifth to it.
parts: Also, if a man eats the holy things in ignorance, then he shall restore the holy thing to the priest and add one-fifth to it.

verses.text: They shall not defile the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer to the Lord,
parts: They shall not defile the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer to the Lord,

verses.text: or allow them to bear the guilt of trespass when they eat their holy things; for I the Lord sanctify them.’ ”
parts: or allow them to bear the guilt of trespass when they eat their holy things; for I the Lord sanctify them.’ ”

verses.text: Again, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the congregation of Israel, and say to them, ‘Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among them in Israel, who offers his gifts in accord with any agreed-on offering or any offering of choice which they offer to God as a whole burnt offering— to be acceptable on your behalf, they must be males without blemish from the cattle, the sheep, or the goats.
parts: Again, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the congregation of Israel, and say to them, ‘Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among them in Israel, who offers his gifts in accord with any agreed-on offering or any offering of choice which they offer to God as a whole burnt offering— to be acceptable on your behalf, they must be males without blemish from the cattle, the sheep, or the goats.

verses.text: “Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the congregation of Israel, and say to them, ‘Whatever man of the children of Israel, or of the resident aliens dwelling among them in Israel, who offers his gifts in accord with any agreed-on offering or any offering of choice which they offer to God as a whole burnt offering—

verses.text: Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard and gather its fruit;
parts: Six years you shall sow your field, and six years you shall prune your vineyard and gather its fruit;

verses.text: but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath rest for the land, a Sabbath to the Lord.
parts: but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath rest for the land, a Sabbath to the Lord.

verses.text: What grows by itself in your field you shall not reap, nor gather the grapes of the vines you dedicated, for it is a year of rest for the land.
parts: What grows by itself in your field you shall not reap, nor gather the grapes of the vines you dedicated, for it is a year of rest for the land.

verses.text: So the products of the land during the Sabbath year shall be food for you: for you, your male and female servants, your hired man, and the alien who dwells with you,
parts: So the products of the land during the Sabbath year shall be food for you: for you, your male and female servants, your hired man, and the alien who dwells with you,

verses.text: and for your cattle and the wild animals in your land—all its produce shall be for food.
parts: and for your cattle and the wild animals in your land—all its produce shall be for food.

verses.text: ‘You shall also count seven years of rest for yourself, seven times seven years; and the time of the seven weeks of years shall be to you forty-nine years. Then you shall sound the trumpet throughout your land on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement you shall make the trumpet to sound throughout all your land. Then you shall sanctify the fiftieth year, and proclaim remission throughout the land to all its inhabitants.
parts: ‘You shall also count seven years of rest for yourself, seven times seven years; and the time of the seven weeks of years shall be to you forty-nine years.
Then you shall sound the trumpet throughout your land on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement you shall make the trumpet to sound throughout all your land.
Then you shall sanctify the fiftieth year, and proclaim remission throughout the land to all its inhabitants.

verses.text: Then you shall sound the trumpet throughout your land on the tenth day of the seventh month; on the Day of Atonement you shall make the trumpet to sound throughout all your land.

verses.text: Then you shall sanctify the fiftieth year, and proclaim remission throughout the land to all its inhabitants.
