verses.text: That fiftieth year shall be the Signal of Remission for you; in it you shall neither sow nor reap what grows by itself, nor gather its sanctified things.
parts: That fiftieth year shall be the Signal of Remission for you; in it you shall neither sow nor reap what grows by itself, nor gather its sanctified things.

verses.text: For it is the Signal of Remission; it shall be holy to you; you shall eat its produce from the field.
parts: For it is the Signal of Remission; it shall be holy to you; you shall eat its produce from the field.

verses.text: ‘In this Year of Remission, each shall return to his possession.
parts: ‘In this Year of Remission, each shall return to his possession.

verses.text: Also, if you should make a sale of land to your neighbor or buy it from him, let a man not oppress his neighbor.
parts: Also, if you should make a sale of land to your neighbor or buy it from him, let a man not oppress his neighbor.

verses.text: According to the number of years after the Signal, you shall buy land tenure from your neighbor, and he shall sell tenure to you according to the number of years of crops.
parts: According to the number of years after the Signal, you shall buy land tenure from your neighbor, and he shall sell tenure to you according to the number of years of crops.

verses.text: According to the increase in years, his acquisition price for tenure should be increased, and according to the fewer number of years his price should be diminished; for he sells to you according to the number of the crops.
parts: According to the increase in years, his acquisition price for tenure should be increased, and according to the fewer number of years his price should be diminished; for he sells to you according to the number of the crops.

verses.text: Therefore, let not a man oppress his neighbor, but you shall fear the Lord your God; for I am the Lord your God.
parts: Therefore, let not a man oppress his neighbor, but you shall fear the Lord your God; for I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: ‘So you shall do all My ordinances and keep My judgments, and do them; then you will dwell in the land in confidence.
parts: ‘So you shall do all My ordinances and keep My judgments, and do them; then you will dwell in the land in confidence.

verses.text: Then the land will yield its produce, and you will eat your fill, and dwell there in confidence.
parts: Then the land will yield its produce, and you will eat your fill, and dwell there in confidence.

verses.text: But if you should say, “What shall we eat in this seventh year, since we shall not sow nor gather in our produce?”
parts: But if you should say, “What shall we eat in this seventh year, since we shall not sow nor gather in our produce?”

verses.text: Then I will command My blessing on you in the sixth year, and it will bring forth produce enough for three years.
parts: Then I will command My blessing on you in the sixth year, and it will bring forth produce enough for three years.

verses.text: And you shall sow in the eighth year, and eat from the old produce until the ninth year; until its produce comes in, you shall eat of the old harvest.
parts: And you shall sow in the eighth year, and eat from the old produce until the ninth year; until its produce comes in, you shall eat of the old harvest.

verses.text: ‘The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is Mine; for in my sight you are resident aliens and sojourners.
parts: ‘The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is Mine; for in my sight you are resident aliens and sojourners.

verses.text: According to all the land of your possession, you shall grant a ransom of the land.
parts: According to all the land of your possession, you shall grant a ransom of the land.

verses.text: If your brother with you becomes poor and has sold some of his possession, and his closest relative comes, then he may redeem what his brother sold.
parts: If your brother with you becomes poor and has sold some of his possession, and his closest relative comes, then he may redeem what his brother sold.

verses.text: Or if the poor man has no close relative to redeem it, but he himself becomes prosperous enough to redeem it,
parts: Or if the poor man has no close relative to redeem it, but he himself becomes prosperous enough to redeem it,

verses.text: then let him compute the years since its sale and return the remainder to the man to whom he sold it, that he may return to his possession.
parts: then let him compute the years since its sale and return the remainder to the man to whom he sold it, that he may return to his possession.

verses.text: But if he does not become prosperous enough to return to it himself, then what was sold shall remain in the hand of him who bought it until the Year of Remission; and in the Remission it shall be released, and he shall return to his possession.
parts: But if he does not become prosperous enough to return to it himself, then what was sold shall remain in the hand of him who bought it until the Year of Remission; and in the Remission it shall be released, and he shall return to his possession.

verses.text: ‘If a man sells a house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year he may redeem it.
parts: ‘If a man sells a house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year he may redeem it.

verses.text: But if it is not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house in the walled city shall belong legally to him who bought it, throughout his generations.
parts: But if it is not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house in the walled city shall belong legally to him who bought it, throughout his generations.

verses.text: However, the houses of unwalled villages shall be counted as belonging to the open country.
parts: However, the houses of unwalled villages shall be counted as belonging to the open country.

verses.text: Nevertheless, the cities of the Levites, and the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.
parts: Nevertheless, the cities of the Levites, and the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.

verses.text: Even whoever purchases a house from the Levites, the house that was sold in the city of their possession shall be released in the Remission; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
parts: Even whoever purchases a house from the Levites, the house that was sold in the city of their possession shall be released in the Remission; for the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.

verses.text: But the fields set apart for their cities may not be sold, for this is their perpetual possession.
parts: But the fields set apart for their cities may not be sold, for this is their perpetual possession.

verses.text: ‘If your brother becomes poor and weak in strength among you, then you shall help him, like a resident alien or a sojourner, that he may live with you.
parts: ‘If your brother becomes poor and weak in strength among you, then you shall help him, like a resident alien or a sojourner, that he may live with you.

verses.text: Take no usury or interest from him; but fear your God—I am the Lord—that your brother may live with you.
parts: Take no usury or interest from him; but fear your God—I am the Lord—that your brother may live with you.

verses.text: You shall not lend him your money for usury, nor lend him your food at a profit.
parts: You shall not lend him your money for usury, nor lend him your food at a profit.

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, so as to be your God.
parts: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, so as to be your God.

verses.text: ‘Now if your brother with you becomes poor and sells himself to you, you shall not compel him to serve as a slave.
parts: ‘Now if your brother with you becomes poor and sells himself to you, you shall not compel him to serve as a slave.

verses.text: But as a hired servant or a sojourner he shall be with you, and shall work for you until the Year of Remission.
parts: But as a hired servant or a sojourner he shall be with you, and shall work for you until the Year of Remission.

verses.text: Then in the Remission he shall depart from you—he and his children with him—and shall return to his own family.
parts: Then in the Remission he shall depart from you—he and his children with him—and shall return to his own family.

verses.text: For they are My personal servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold with the sale of a household servant.
parts: For they are My personal servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt; they shall not be sold with the sale of a household servant.

verses.text: You shall not overwork him with labor, but you shall fear the Lord your God.
parts: You shall not overwork him with labor, but you shall fear the Lord your God.

verses.text: As for the male and female servants you may have from the Gentiles around you, from them you may buy male and female servants.
parts: As for the male and female servants you may have from the Gentiles around you, from them you may buy male and female servants.

verses.text: Moreover you may buy some of the children of sojourners dwelling among you, and some of their families with you, which they beget in your land; and they shall become your possession.
parts: Moreover you may buy some of the children of sojourners dwelling among you, and some of their families with you, which they beget in your land; and they shall become your possession.

verses.text: You may also distribute them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them as a permanent possession.
parts: You may also distribute them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them as a permanent possession.

verses.text: ‘Now if a resident alien or sojourner with you prospers, and your brother becomes poor and sells himself to the resident alien or sojourner with you, or to a member of the resident alien's family, after he is sold he may be redeemed again.
parts: ‘Now if a resident alien or sojourner with you prospers, and your brother becomes poor and sells himself to the resident alien or sojourner with you, or to a member of the resident alien's family, after he is sold he may be redeemed again.

verses.text: after he is sold he may be redeemed again.
parts: after he is sold he may be redeemed again.

verses.text: or his uncle or his uncle's son may redeem him; or anyone near of kin to him in his family may redeem him; or if he is able he may redeem himself.
parts: or his uncle or his uncle's son may redeem him; or anyone near of kin to him in his family may redeem him; or if he is able he may redeem himself.

verses.text: Thus he shall compute the years with him who bought him: The price of his release shall be according to the number of years from the year that he was sold to him until the Year of Remission; it shall be according to the time he was a hired servant for him.
parts: Thus he shall compute the years with him who bought him: The price of his release shall be according to the number of years from the year that he was sold to him until the Year of Remission; it shall be according to the time he was a hired servant for him.

verses.text: If there are still more years remaining to someone, he shall pay his ransom from the money of his sale.
parts: If there are still more years remaining to someone, he shall pay his ransom from the money of his sale.

verses.text: Now if there remain but a few years until the Year of Remission, then he shall compute with him, and according to his years, he shall repay his ransom.
parts: Now if there remain but a few years until the Year of Remission, then he shall compute with him, and according to his years, he shall repay his ransom.

verses.text: He shall be with him as a hired servant year by year, and you shall not allow someone to overwork him with labor in your sight.
parts: He shall be with him as a hired servant year by year, and you shall not allow someone to overwork him with labor in your sight.

verses.text: But if he is not redeemed in these years he shall be released in the Year of Remission—he and his children with him.
parts: But if he is not redeemed in these years he shall be released in the Year of Remission—he and his children with him.

verses.text: For the children of Israel are personal servants to Me; they are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.
parts: For the children of Israel are personal servants to Me; they are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt: I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: ‘Now you shall not make handcrafted objects for yourselves; neither a carved image nor a pillar shall you rear up for yourselves; nor shall you set up a distinctive stone in your land, to worship it; for I am the Lord your God.
parts: ‘Now you shall not make handcrafted objects for yourselves; neither a carved image nor a pillar shall you rear up for yourselves; nor shall you set up a distinctive stone in your land, to worship it; for I am the Lord your God.

verses.text: You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My holy things: I am the Lord.
parts: You shall keep My Sabbaths and reverence My holy things: I am the Lord.

verses.text: ‘If you walk in My ordinances and keep My commandments, and do them, then I will give you rain in its season, the land shall yield its produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
parts: ‘If you walk in My ordinances and keep My commandments, and do them,
then I will give you rain in its season, the land shall yield its produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.

verses.text: then I will give you rain in its season, the land shall yield its produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
parts: then I will give you rain in its season, the land shall yield its produce, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.

verses.text: Your threshing shall last till the time of vintage, and the vintage shall last till the time of sowing; and you shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
parts: Your threshing shall last till the time of vintage, and the vintage shall last till the time of sowing; and you shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.

verses.text: War shall not pass through your land, and I will give peace in the land; and you shall lie down, and none will make you afraid; and I will utterly destroy the bad wild animals from the land.
parts: War shall not pass through your land, and I will give peace in the land; and you shall lie down, and none will make you afraid; and I will utterly destroy the bad wild animals from the land.

verses.text: You will chase your enemies, and they shall fall by slaughter before you.
parts: You will chase your enemies, and they shall fall by slaughter before you.

verses.text: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight; your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.
parts: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight; your enemies shall fall by the sword before you.

verses.text: For I will look upon you and make you fruitful, and multiply and establish My covenant with you.
parts: For I will look upon you and make you fruitful, and multiply and establish My covenant with you.

verses.text: You shall eat the old harvest of the past two years, and clear out the old because of the new.
parts: You shall eat the old harvest of the past two years, and clear out the old because of the new.

verses.text: I will establish My covenant among you, and My soul shall not abhor you.
parts: I will establish My covenant among you, and My soul shall not abhor you.

verses.text: I will walk among you and be your God, and you shall be My people.
parts: I will walk among you and be your God, and you shall be My people.

verses.text: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their servants; I broke the bands of your yoke and made you walk with confidence.
parts: I am the Lord your God, who brings you out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their servants; I broke the bands of your yoke and made you walk with confidence.

verses.text: ‘Now if you do not obey Me, neither do all these ordinances, but your soul disobeys them and despises My judgments, so as not to do all My commandments but to shatter My covenant, I also will do thus to you: I will bring difficulty upon you, both the itch, the jaundice, the gangrenous eyes, and the withering away of your life.
parts: ‘Now if you do not obey Me, neither do all these ordinances, but your soul disobeys them and despises My judgments, so as not to do all My commandments but to shatter My covenant, I also will do thus to you: I will bring difficulty upon you, both the itch, the jaundice, the gangrenous eyes, and the withering away of your life.

verses.text: but your soul disobeys them and despises My judgments, so as not to do all My commandments but to shatter My covenant,
parts: but your soul disobeys them and despises My judgments, so as not to do all My commandments but to shatter My covenant,

verses.text: I also will do thus to you: I will bring difficulty upon you, both the itch, the jaundice, the gangrenous eyes, and the withering away of your life.
parts: I also will do thus to you: I will bring difficulty upon you, both the itch, the jaundice, the gangrenous eyes, and the withering away of your life.

verses.text: I will set My face against you, and you shall fall before your enemies.
parts: I will set My face against you, and you shall fall before your enemies.

verses.text: ‘Then after all this, if you do not obey Me, I will increase your punishment seven times more for your sins.
parts: ‘Then after all this, if you do not obey Me, I will increase your punishment seven times more for your sins.

verses.text: I will crush your excessive arrogance; I will make your sky like iron and your earth like bronze.
parts: I will crush your excessive arrogance; I will make your sky like iron and your earth like bronze.

verses.text: Your strength shall be spent in vain; for your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.
parts: Your strength shall be spent in vain; for your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.

verses.text: Then if after this, you walk contrariwise and are not willing to obey Me, I will bring on you seven times more plagues, according to your sins.
parts: Then if after this, you walk contrariwise and are not willing to obey Me, I will bring on you seven times more plagues, according to your sins.

verses.text: I will also send among you the wild animals of the land; and they will eat you, and utterly destroy your cattle, and make you few in number; and your highways shall be desolate.
parts: I will also send among you the wild animals of the land; and they will eat you, and utterly destroy your cattle, and make you few in number; and your highways shall be desolate.

verses.text: ‘Then if by these things you are not corrected by Me, but walk contrary to Me, then I also will walk in hostility to you, and I will strike you yet seven times for your sins.
parts: ‘Then if by these things you are not corrected by Me, but walk contrary to Me, then I also will walk in hostility to you, and I will strike you yet seven times for your sins.

verses.text: then I also will walk in hostility to you, and I will strike you yet seven times for your sins.
parts: then I also will walk in hostility to you, and I will strike you yet seven times for your sins.

verses.text: I will also strike you with the sword, exacting the vengeance of the covenant; and you will flee for refuge to your cities.
parts: I will also strike you with the sword, exacting the vengeance of the covenant; and you will flee for refuge to your cities.

verses.text: When you are afflicted by want of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven; and they shall dole out your bread by measure, and you shall eat and still be hungry.
parts: When you are afflicted by want of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven; and they shall dole out your bread by measure, and you shall eat and still be hungry.

verses.text: ‘Now if after all this, you do not obey Me, but walk contrary to Me, then I also will walk in hostility to you; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.
parts: ‘Now if after all this, you do not obey Me, but walk contrary to Me, then I also will walk in hostility to you; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.

verses.text: then I also will walk in hostility to you; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.
parts: then I also will walk in hostility to you; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.

verses.text: Then you shall eat the flesh of your sons and daughters.
parts: Then you shall eat the flesh of your sons and daughters.

verses.text: I will make desolate your pillars, and will utterly destroy your wooden handcrafted objects; and I will put your carcasses on the carcasses of your idols, and My soul shall abhor you.
parts: I will make desolate your pillars, and will utterly destroy your wooden handcrafted objects; and I will put your carcasses on the carcasses of your idols, and My soul shall abhor you.

verses.text: I will lay your cities waste, and bring your holy things to desolation; and I will not smell the odor of your sacrifices.
parts: I will lay your cities waste, and bring your holy things to desolation; and I will not smell the odor of your sacrifices.

verses.text: I will bring your land to desolation, and your enemies who dwell in it shall be astonished at it.
parts: I will bring your land to desolation, and your enemies who dwell in it shall be astonished at it.

verses.text: I will scatter you among the Gentiles, and the sword shall suddenly destroy you.
parts: I will scatter you among the Gentiles, and the sword shall suddenly destroy you.

verses.text: Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths as long as it lies desolate, and you are in your enemies’ land.
parts: Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths as long as it lies desolate, and you are in your enemies’ land.

verses.text: As long as it lies desolate it shall rest—for the time it did not rest on your Sabbaths when you dwelt in it.
parts: As long as it lies desolate it shall rest—for the time it did not rest on your Sabbaths when you dwelt in it.

verses.text: ‘Now as for those of you remaining in the land, I will send faintness into their heart in the land of their enemies; and the sound of the shaking leaf shall chase them.
parts: ‘Now as for those of you remaining in the land, I will send faintness into their heart in the land of their enemies; and the sound of the shaking leaf shall chase them.

verses.text: Brother shall disregard brother as in warfare though no one is in pursuit; and you will be unable to withstand your enemies.
parts: Brother shall disregard brother as in warfare though no one is in pursuit; and you will be unable to withstand your enemies.

verses.text: You shall perish among the Gentiles, and the land of your enemies shall devour you.
parts: You shall perish among the Gentiles, and the land of your enemies shall devour you.

verses.text: Now those of you who are left shall be destroyed because of their sins, and waste away in their enemies’ land.
parts: Now those of you who are left shall be destroyed because of their sins, and waste away in their enemies’ land.

verses.text: ‘But if they confess their sins and the sins of their fathers, that they transgressed and disregarded Me and walked contrary to Me, and that I also have walked in hostility to them and destroyed them in the land of their enemies, then their uncircumcised heart will feel ashamed, and they will render satisfaction for their guilt.
parts: ‘But if they confess their sins and the sins of their fathers, that they transgressed and disregarded Me and walked contrary to Me, and that I also have walked in hostility to them and destroyed them in the land of their enemies, then their uncircumcised heart will feel ashamed, and they will render satisfaction for their guilt.

verses.text: and that I also have walked in hostility to them and destroyed them in the land of their enemies, then their uncircumcised heart will feel ashamed, and they will render satisfaction for their guilt.
parts: and that I also have walked in hostility to them and destroyed them in the land of their enemies, then their uncircumcised heart will feel ashamed, and they will render satisfaction for their guilt.

verses.text: Then I will remember My covenant with Jacob, and My covenant with Isaac, and My covenant with Abraham I will remember; and I will remember the land.
parts: Then I will remember My covenant with Jacob, and My covenant with Isaac, and My covenant with Abraham I will remember; and I will remember the land.

verses.text: The land also shall be deserted by them; and the land will enjoy its Sabbaths while it lies desolate because of them.
parts: The land also shall be deserted by them; and the land will enjoy its Sabbaths while it lies desolate because of them.

verses.text: Yet for all that, when they were in the land of their enemies, I did not neglect them nor treat them with contempt, so as to utterly destroy them and break My covenant with them; for I am the Lord their God.
parts: Yet for all that, when they were in the land of their enemies, I did not neglect them nor treat them with contempt, so as to utterly destroy them and break My covenant with them; for I am the Lord their God.

verses.text: But I will remember their former covenant when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, in the sight of the Gentiles, to be their God: I am the Lord.’ ”
parts: But I will remember their former covenant when I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, in the sight of the Gentiles, to be their God: I am the Lord.’ ”

verses.text: These are the judgments, the ordinances, and the law which the Lord made between Himself and the children of Israel on Mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.
parts: These are the judgments, the ordinances, and the law which the Lord made between Himself and the children of Israel on Mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying, “Speak to the children of Is-rael, and say to them, ‘When a man vows a vow to the Lord equivalent to the value of his soul, and if your valuation is of a male from twenty years old up to sixty years old, his valuation shall be fifty didrachm of silver, according to the pure measure.
parts: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

“Speak to the children of Is-rael, and say to them, ‘When a man vows a vow to the Lord equivalent to the value of his soul, and if your valuation is of a male from twenty years old up to sixty years old, his valuation shall be fifty didrachm of silver, according to the pure measure.

verses.text: But if it is of a female, your valuation shall be thirty didrachm;
parts: But if it is of a female, your valuation shall be thirty didrachm;

verses.text: and if from five years old up to twenty years old, your valuation for a male shall be twenty didrachm, and for a female ten didrachm;
parts: and if from five years old up to twenty years old, your valuation for a male shall be twenty didrachm, and for a female ten didrachm;

verses.text: and if from a month old up to five years old, your valuation for a male shall be five didrachm of silver, and for a female, three didrachm of silver;
parts: and if from a month old up to five years old, your valuation for a male shall be five didrachm of silver, and for a female, three didrachm of silver;

verses.text: and if from sixty years old and above, if it is a male, then your valuation shall be fifteen didrachm, and for a female ten didrachm.
parts: and if from sixty years old and above, if it is a male, then your valuation shall be fifteen didrachm, and for a female ten didrachm.

verses.text: But if he is too poor to pay your valuation, he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall set a value for him; according to the ability of him who vowed, the priest shall value him.
parts: But if he is too poor to pay your valuation, he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall set a value for him; according to the ability of him who vowed, the priest shall value him.

verses.text: If they bring from the cattle a gift to the Lord, whoever gives from these to the Lord, his gift shall be holy.
parts: If they bring from the cattle a gift to the Lord, whoever gives from these to the Lord, his gift shall be holy.

verses.text: He shall not change it, good for bad or bad for good; and if he changes it at all, cattle for cattle, then both it and that which is changed shall be holy.
parts: He shall not change it, good for bad or bad for good; and if he changes it at all, cattle for cattle, then both it and that which is changed shall be holy.

verses.text: But if it is any unclean animal which they do not offer as a gift to the Lord, he shall present the animal before the priest;
parts: But if it is any unclean animal which they do not offer as a gift to the Lord, he shall present the animal before the priest;

verses.text: and the priest shall set a value for it, whether good or bad; and as the priest values it, so it shall stand.
parts: and the priest shall set a value for it, whether good or bad; and as the priest values it, so it shall stand.

verses.text: But if he wants at all to redeem it, then he must add one-fifth to his valuation.
parts: But if he wants at all to redeem it, then he must add one-fifth to his valuation.

verses.text: And when a man sanctifies his house to be holy to the Lord, then the priest shall set a value for it, whether good or bad; as the priest values it, so it shall stand.
parts: And when a man sanctifies his house to be holy to the Lord, then the priest shall set a value for it, whether good or bad; as the priest values it, so it shall stand.

verses.text: If he who sanctified his house wants to redeem it, he must add one-fifth of the silver of its valuation, and it shall be his.
parts: If he who sanctified his house wants to redeem it, he must add one-fifth of the silver of its valuation, and it shall be his.

verses.text: Now if a man sanctifies part of the field of his possession to the Lord, then the valuation shall be according to the seed required for it: a cor of barley for fifty didrachm of silver.
parts: Now if a man sanctifies part of the field of his possession to the Lord, then the valuation shall be according to the seed required for it: a cor of barley for fifty didrachm of silver.

verses.text: If he sanctifies part of his field from the Year of Remission, according to his valuation it shall stand.
parts: If he sanctifies part of his field from the Year of Remission, according to his valuation it shall stand.

verses.text: But if he sanctifies his field subsequently after the Jubilee, the priest shall reckon to him the silver due according to the years that remain till the Year of Remission, and it shall be deducted from his valuation.
parts: But if he sanctifies his field subsequently after the Jubilee, the priest shall reckon to him the silver due according to the years that remain till the Year of Remission, and it shall be deducted from his valuation.

verses.text: And if he who sanctifies the field ever wishes to redeem it, he must add one-fifth of the silver to his valuation, and it shall belong to him.
parts: And if he who sanctifies the field ever wishes to redeem it, he must add one-fifth of the silver to his valuation, and it shall belong to him.

verses.text: But if he does not want to redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed anymore;
parts: But if he does not want to redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed anymore;

verses.text: but the field, when it is released in the Remission, shall be holy to the Lord, as a field set apart; it shall be the possession of the priest.
parts: but the field, when it is released in the Remission, shall be holy to the Lord, as a field set apart; it shall be the possession of the priest.

verses.text: But if a man sanctifies to the Lord part of a field he bought which is not the field of his possession,
parts: But if a man sanctifies to the Lord part of a field he bought which is not the field of his possession,

verses.text: then the priest shall reckon to him its full assessment from the Year of Remission, and he shall pay its valuation on that day as holy to the Lord.
parts: then the priest shall reckon to him its full assessment from the Year of Remission, and he shall pay its valuation on that day as holy to the Lord.

verses.text: Then in the Year of Remission, the field shall return to the man from whom he bought it, to the one who owned the land as a possession.
parts: Then in the Year of Remission, the field shall return to the man from whom he bought it, to the one who owned the land as a possession.

verses.text: Now all your valuations shall be according to the pure measures: twenty obols to the didrachm.
parts: Now all your valuations shall be according to the pure measures: twenty obols to the didrachm.

verses.text: But the firstborn of your cattle, which shall be the Lord's firstborn, no man shall sanctify, whether a young calf or sheep; it is the Lord's.
parts: But the firstborn of your cattle, which shall be the Lord's firstborn, no man shall sanctify, whether a young calf or sheep; it is the Lord's.

verses.text: Now if it is an unclean four-footed animal, he shall change it according to his valuation; and he shall add one-fifth to it, and it will be his.
parts: Now if it is an unclean four-footed animal, he shall change it according to his valuation; and he shall add one-fifth to it, and it will be his.

verses.text: Nevertheless, any devoted thing a man may devote to the Lord of anything he has, man or animal, or part of the field of his possession, shall not be sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy to the Lord.
parts: Nevertheless, any devoted thing a man may devote to the Lord of anything he has, man or animal, or part of the field of his possession, shall not be sold or redeemed; every devoted thing is most holy to the Lord.

verses.text: Furthermore, people devoted to the Lord shall not be redeemed, but shall surely be put to death.
parts: Furthermore, people devoted to the Lord shall not be redeemed, but shall surely be put to death.

verses.text: Now all the tithe of the land, whether seed of the land or fruit of the tree, is the Lord's.
parts: Now all the tithe of the land, whether seed of the land or fruit of the tree, is the Lord's.

verses.text: If a man wants at all to redeem his tithe, he shall add one-fifth to it, and it will be his.
parts: If a man wants at all to redeem his tithe, he shall add one-fifth to it, and it will be his.

verses.text: Now concerning the tithe of the oxen or the sheep, of whatever passes in the numbering under the rod, the tenth one shall be holy to the Lord.
parts: Now concerning the tithe of the oxen or the sheep, of whatever passes in the numbering under the rod, the tenth one shall be holy to the Lord.

verses.text: You shall not change good for bad; but if he changes it at all, both it and that which is changed shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.’ ”
parts: You shall not change good for bad; but if he changes it at all, both it and that which is changed shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.’ ”

verses.text: These are the commandments the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
parts: These are the commandments the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
S A C R I F I C E
n the Book of Leviticus and detailed further in

, the Lord commands Moses to institute a comprehensive system of ritual sacrifices to be offered by the priests on behalf of the people of God, thus giving the Hebrews a means to be reconciled with God and to restore harmony amongst themselves, relationships disrupted by sin. The word “sacrifice” means to make holy or sacred. These sacrifices and offerings—offered first at the tabernacle and later in the temple—were basically of two types: animal (cattle, sheep, goats, doves) and vegetable (wheat, barley, olive oil, wine, cereal, frankincense). The offerings were types prefiguring a greater reality to be fulfilled in the coming Incarnation of Christ.
In the Old Testament animal sacrifices, the blood shed and poured out represented the life-force of the animal offered to God (

). The animal was more than simply a substitute for the worshiper. There was also identification between the animal sacrificed and the one on whose behalf it was offered, explaining the emphasis in the Old Testament on the blood of the sacrifice (
). These sacrifices point to the blood of Christ in the New Testament: “My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many for the remission of sins” (
; see also
On the Day of Atonement, the preeminent Old Testament sacrifice was made. It was to atone for all the sins the nation of Israel had committed that year (

). The ceremony included (1) animal sacrifices as offerings for sins, and (2) the placing of “all the transgressions of the children of Israel . . . on the head of the living kid”—the scapegoat—which was then driven off into the wilderness (
). This event prefigures the once-for-all self-sacrifice of Christ, our great High Priest (
), who takes upon Himself all the sins of all humanity (
), tramples down death by His voluntary Death on the cross, and thereby reconciles us to God (

Christ’s once-for-all offering of Himself is for all people for all time, and supersedes the Mosaic sacrificial system. Accordingly, the mystery of the eucharistic service, accomplished within the Divine Liturgy of the Church, is done “in remembrance” of Christ’s sacrifice (

) and is a “reasonable and bloodless sacrifice” to be understood as our sacrifice-offering to God—“a mercy of peace, a sacrifice of praise.” In the Divine Liturgy, instead of an animal or grain offering, we offer the Body and Blood of Christ to God. In a mystery known only to God, we thereby participate in the very Body and Blood of Christ offered once for all. And in this substantial union between Christ—the One sacrificed—and the worshiper, we come to more fully understand how we are united to Christ in our baptism and nurtured in our union with Christ by the eucharistic offering. The Church prays, “Thine own of Thine own we offer unto Thee, on behalf of all and for all.”
Offering sacrifices never exempted the Hebrews from the duty to live prayerfully and morally (
). Moreover, Old Testament prophets stood against empty ritual and vain sacrifice (
). Hence, the Mosaic sacrificial system not only prefigures Christ’s own sacrifice, but also points to the pouring out of ourselves in self-sacrificial service as detailed in
and

P E N T E C O S T
he Feast of Weeks was the festival celebrated at the beginning of the grain harvest (

). This was the feast at which the Hebrews offered their firstfruits of the harvest to the Lord at the tabernacle. It was one of the three major Jewish feasts, along with the Passover and the Feast of Tabernacles (see
According to

, the Feast was celebrated for seven consecutive weeks beginning “the morning following the Sabbath day” of Passover. Thus comes its title, the “Feast of Weeks.” Later in the Old Testament this feast became known as “Pentecost” (“fiftieth”), since it was celebrated on the fiftieth day after Passover (see

lessons.title: PENTECOST: A FULFILLMENT OF THE JEWISH FEAST

parts: The Jewish Feast of Pentecost was fulfilled as described in
. On this Day of Pentecost came the outpouring of the Holy Spirit upon the disciples of Christ, as Christ Himself had promised (
). The descent of the Holy Spirit fulfills the Jewish Feast of Pentecost in a number of ways.

1 The reaping of the firstfruits of the grain harvest is fulfilled by the first harvest on the Day of Pentecost, which consisted of the Jews who believed and were baptized. St. John Chrysostom says the Holy Spirit “came down as the keen-edged sickle.”
2 The offering of the two “deposit loaves” of leavened bread (

) is prophetic of the ingathering of both Jews and Gentiles (Bede). St. John Cassian says the preaching of the apostles on the Day of Pentecost was “the true bread of the first fruits . . . when five thousand men were filled with the gift of its food” (
3 The fiftieth day—seven consecutive weeks following Pascha plus one day—indicates the fullness of time in a mystery, similar to the Christian understanding of the eighth day.
4 The giving of the Law to Moses by the Son of God is brought to completion by the giving of the Spirit (see
) to the Church.

The Orthodox services for Pentecost place their emphasis on the descent of the Holy Spirit in all His fullness. His descent means that the Mosaic Law, given by the Lawgiver and honored on the Jewish feast day of Pentecost, is now transcended: “The All-Holy Spirit, who freely distributes gifts to all, has descended and come to earth; not as He formerly had in the Law’s dark shadow, shining in the Prophets, but now in very truth, He is bestowed in us through Christ” (Vespers, Thursday after Pentecost).

The worship services for Pentecost repeatedly emphasize how Old Testament prophecies of the Holy Spirit are fulfilled on this day. Two of the greatest of these prophecies are found in the Old Testament readings for this Feast—
and
. St. Peter directly quotes the passage from Joel in his exhortation to the Jews on the Day of Pentecost (
). A third reading—

—relates how the Lord commands Moses to select seventy of the elders of Israel, who, when the Spirit comes upon them, prophesy at the tabernacle. The comment of Moses regarding this event, “Would that all the Lord’s people might be prophets when the Lord would put His Spirit upon them” (
), is prophetic of the Day of Pentecost.
A hymn for the Feast of Pentecost declares, “Once, when He descended and confounded the tongues, the Most High divided the nations [
]; and when He divided the tongues of fire, He called all men into unity; and with one accord we glorify the All-holy Spirit.”
